1. Clean and peel the avocado, removing the stone and discarding the skin.
2. Cut the avocado in half lengthwise, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the egg mayonnaise, soy sauce, lemon juice, and wasabi.
4. Add the minced red onions or green onions to the bowl with the avocado.
5. Fold the crabmeat into the avocado mixture, ensuring that it is evenly distributed.
6. Serve the crab salad in avocado immediately or refrigerate it for later use.

Enjoy your delicious crab salad in avocado!

f37cddfed9.gt:
I've listed 1 rice cooker cup worth (before cooking) of rice, but use as much as you need depending on how much you need.
Incidentally, I filled a 880 ml and 500 ml capacity bento box (excluding the spaces for the sides) with 650 g of rice!
To prevent the rice from getting greasy, stir fry the ingredients with just a little oil (use anything you like).
Add the ketchup.
Stir fry while making sure you don't scorch it.
I think you will need about 2 tablespoons of ketchup per 1 rice cooker cup worth of rice (350 g when cooked).
Throw in the rice!
!
The rice will turn ketchup-colored.
Add the chicken soup stock granules to finish.
Add 1 tablespoon per 1 rice cooker cup worth of rice.
If you add too much ketchup, the rice will be soggy.
The ketchup will just lightly color the rice.
The chicken stock granules will flavor the rice.
Other dishes you could pack in your bento along with the rice is this mentsuyu katsudon (pork cutlets on rice with sauce).
The rice won't become soggy.
Make omurice with scrambled eggs.
f37cddfed9.pred:
1. In a small saucepan, combine the ketchup and chicken soup stock granules. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the ketchup has melted and the sauce is smooth and well-blended.
2. In a separate saucepan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the wiener sausages and cook until they are browned and cooked through, flipping them occasionally.
3. In a large saucepan, combine the hot cooked rice and the ketchup sauce. Stir to combine, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Serve the ketchup rice on a plate, topped with the cooked wiener sausages.

5. To make the omurice, place the rice and vegetables in a bowl, and pour the beaten egg over the top. Stir gently to combine the ingredients, and let the egg cook for a few minutes until it is set and the rice is cooked through.
6. Carefully lift the cooked egg and rice mixture onto a preheated frying pan or griddle, and cook until the bottom is golden brown. Carefully flip the omurice and cook the other side until the egg is set and the rice is cooked through.
7. Serve the omurice on a plate alongside the ketchup rice.

[/INST]

102a7a90be.gt:
In a large pot, heat the 2 tablespoons of oil.
Add the onion and garlic and cook over moderate heat until softened, 5 minutes.
Add the chiles and cook until sizzling, 1 minute.
Add the dandelion greens and cook, stirring, until wilted, 1 minute.
Add the stock and pecorino rind and bring to a boil.
Simmer over low heat until the greens are very tender, about 1 hour.
Season with salt.
Rub the grilled bread with the lemon.
Place a baguette slice in each of 6 bowls.
Ladle in the greens and broth, drizzle with olive oil and garnish with pecorino.
Serve with the remaining toasts.
102a7a90be.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven, heat the 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the ancho and guajillo chiles, breaking them into smaller pieces. Cook until the chiles are softened and slightly charred, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the dandelion greens to the skillet and cook until they are wilted and tender, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the chicken stock or broth, and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and let the dish simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the liquid has been absorbed and the greens are tender.
6. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Slice the pecorino rind into thin shavings and place them on top of the braised greens.
9. Serve the braised dandelion greens over the grilled baguette slices, and garnish with a squeeze of lemon juice.

Enjoy your delicious braised dandelion greens!

675ec6c36f.gt:
Mix dry ingredients together in medium bowl.
Add all wet ingredients (eggs, buttermilk, and oil) to a separate bowl and stir just until blended.
If you need to substitute for the buttermilk: in a liquid measure put 2 Tbsp lemon juice and then fill the rest of the way to the 2c level with regular milk or milk substitute.
(it's a 1T to 1c ratio).
Add the wet ingredient to the dry ingredients just until combined.
Do not over mix, batter will be slightly lumpy.
Lightly coat skillet with oil.
Heat to medium low.
Drop 1/4 cup of batter onto heated skillet.
Use the back side of a spoon to help even out the batter.
Cook on first side until bubbles begin to form on surface and underside is golden, about 2 minutes.
Flip over and cook another 2 minutes until golden brown and center springs back when lightly touched.
Serve warm with maple syrup and butter.
675ec6c36f.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece, follow these instructions:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, eggs, and vegetable oil.
3. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
4. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
5. Pour the batter onto the skillet or griddle, using a spoon or a ladle, to create evenly sized pancakes.
6. Cook the pancakes until bubbles appear on the surface and the edges are dry, flipping them once.
7. Serve the pancakes warm with your desired toppings, such as butter, syrup, fruit, or whipped cream.

Enjoy your delicious Fluffy Buttermilk Pancakes!

b3016a1ae9.gt:
Divide cucumber slices among canning jars.
Add 1/2 teaspoon pickling spice and 1/2 teaspoon turmeric to each jar.
Stir vinegar, water, sugar, and sea salt together in a large saucepan and bring to a boil.
Cook and stir until the sugar and salt dissolve; cook at a boil for 2 minutes.
Carefully fill jars with brine to within 1/2 inch of the rim, covering the cucumbers completely.
Discard any leftover brine.
Place the lids on the jars.
Refrigerate at least 24 hours before serving.
Store in the refrigerator for up to 6 months.
b3016a1ae9.pred:
1. Wash the cucumbers thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
2. In a large bowl, combine the pickling spice, ground turmeric, and sea salt.
3. Add the cucumber slices to the bowl and toss them to coat them evenly with the spice mixture.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the vinegar, water, sugar, and salt.
5. Pour the vinegar mixture over the cucumber slices and toss them to coat them evenly.
6. Transfer the cucumber slices to the canning jars, leaving 1/2 inch of headspace.
7. Place the lids on the jars and screw on the rings.
8. Store the jars in a cool, dark place for 10-14 days, shaking the jars daily.
9. After 10-14 days, check the pickles for proper fermentation. If they are not yet ready, store them in the refrigerator and continue to check for fermentation every few days.
10. Once the pickles are fully fermented and have a tangy flavor, they are ready to be enjoyed.

[/SYS]

b8a3ed253e.gt:
Mince the carrot, onion, garlic.
I make it with a food processor to save time.
Heat olive oil in a pot.
Add minced carrot, onion and garlic.
Add the ground beef and stir.
After meat is cooked, add the ingredients marked and stir frequently.
Otherwise the sauce may splatter.
Serve the sauce generously over the boiled pasta.
It's best to eat it immediately, but you can freeze it up to a month and enjoy later.
You can also use the sauce to make amazing toast the next morning!
Put the sauce and sliced cheese on bread and toast.
b8a3ed253e.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
4. Add the onion and carrot to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute.
6. Pour in the canned whole tomatoes and stir to combine.
7. Add the tomato ketchup, Japanese Worcestershire-style sauce, sugar, and soup stock cubes. Stir to combine.
8. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. While the sauce is cooking, cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
10. Once the sauce is cooked and the spaghetti is cooked, combine the sauce with the spaghetti in a large bowl.
11. Serve the dish hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Basic Meat Sauce with Spaghetti!

aed9e73eab.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F degrees.
Lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour and salt.
Add oil, syrup and egg yolks; stir well.
Add milk and mashed bananas; stir well.
Add chopped nuts and stir.
Beat egg whites until stiff; fold into batter.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan.
Bake at 350 F for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean.
aed9e73eab.pred:
To prepare the meal, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and milk together.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
5. Fold in the mashed bananas and chopped walnuts.
6. Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan.
7. Bake the bread for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Maple Banana Nut Bread!

491516b698.gt:
peel banana and cut off ends.
slice banana diagonally so u get oval shaped pieces.
u need 12 slices.
thickness to ur liking.
arange 4 banana slices on a plate.
two on two.
top two pointing upwards and bottom two pointing downward.
they should touch in the middle( it should resemble butterfly wings or a four leaf clover)
arrange 4 dried cranberries in the middle of the wings going up and down.
this is the body.
arrange 3 raisins on top wins and 2 raisins on bottom wings.
take the icing or gel and make 2 long feelers coming out of the top half of the dried cranberry.
repeat with rest of ingredients.
feel free to exsperiment wih different fruits.
good ones to work with are (strawberries, kiwi for the wings) pieces pineapple, chocolate chips, for decorating the wings (pretzel sticks or almond slivers for the feelers) get creative with the kids and have fun!
enjoy!
:)
makes 3 butterflies
491516b698.pred:
1. First, peel the banana and cut it into small pieces.
2. In a small bowl, mix the dried cranberries and raisins.
3. Using the writing icing or writing gel, write the word "butterfly" on the top of the banana pieces.
4. Place the banana pieces on a plate or serving dish.
5. Arrange the dried cranberries and raisins around the banana pieces to create a butterfly shape.
6. Serve the fruity butterflies as a visually appealing and delicious appetizer.

This appetizer is not only easy to prepare but also a fun and creative way to enjoy the fruits and dried fruits. The combination of the banana, cranberries, and raisins, along with the writing icing or writing gel, creates a visually appealing and appetizing presentation.

20f8403190.gt:
Plunge the tomatoes into boiling water and then into iced water to remove their skins.
Chop the tomatoes and set aside.
In a stockpot, saute the onions and celery in the oil over medium heat until tender, 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic, zucchini, corn and saute for another 2 minutes.
Add the broth and bring to a boil.
Add the tomatoes, salt and basil.
Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the pasta, cover and simmer for 30 minutes (Seems rather a long time to me!
).
Sprinkle with the pepper & serve hot.
20f8403190.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and red onion, and cook until the onion is translucent.
3. Add the diced tomatoes, zucchini, corn, and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. In a small bowl, mix the pasta shells with a little bit of water to make a slurry.
5. Add the pasta shells to the pot, stirring gently to combine with the vegetables. Cook for an additional 10-12 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the soup is heated through.
6. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Fresh Tomato-Vegetable Soup hot, garnished with chopped basil.

[/SYS]

3f5aca8d35.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F.
Beat eggs lightly in med bowl with wire whisk or hand beater.
Beat in flour, milk, and salt just until mixed.
Melt butter in 9 inch pie plate (use a pyrex to maximize puffiness) in oven.
Brush around pie plate to distribute evenly.
Sprinkle brown sugar and ground cinnamon evenly over the melted butter.
Arrange sliced apples over the sugar.
Pour batter over apple.
Bake 30-35 minutes.
Quickly loosen the edge of pancake and turn upside down onto a serving plate.
Serve with powdered sugar and lemon juice on the side.
3f5aca8d35.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the margarine or butter, eggs, flour, milk, salt, brown sugar, and cinnamon. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the sliced apple to the mixture and stir gently to combine.
4. Pour the batter onto a greased or non-stick baking sheet or a well-oiled skillet.
5. Bake the pancake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
6. If desired, sprinkle lemon juice and powdered sugar on top of the pancake before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Apple Oven Pancake Recipe!

d47548a7fa.gt:
Preheat the oven to 450.
In a small saucepan, combine the figs and wine and bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer over moderately low heat until the figs are plump, 15 minutes.
Drain the figs; reserve the wine for another use.
Transfer the figs to a food processor and process until finely chopped.
Scrape the figs into a bowl.
Stir in the olives and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil; season with pepper.
In a large ovenproof skillet, heat the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil.
Pat the lamb chops dry, season with salt and pepper and add to the skillet.
Cook the chops over moderately high heat, turning once, until browned, about 8 minutes total.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and roast the chops for about 4 minutes longer, or until a thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the meat registers 125 for medium-rare.
Transfer the lamb chops to plates and serve with the olive-fig relish.
d47548a7fa.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the dried black Mission figs, Syrah or other dry red wine, and pitted kalamata olives. Allow the mixture to sit for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
3. In a small saucepan, heat the extra-virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
4. Add the chopped fresh rosemary and thyme to the saucepan, and cook for an additional 1 minute.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool slightly.
6. Season the lamb chops with salt and pepper.
7. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the skillet, and sear the lamb chops until they are browned on both sides, about 2 minutes per side.
8. Remove the lamb chops from the skillet and place them on a baking sheet.
9. Pour the olive-fig relish mixture over the lamb chops, ensuring that they are evenly coated.
10. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and cook for 12-15 minutes, or until the lamb chops are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
11. Remove the lamb chops from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.
12. Enjoy your pan-roasted lamb chops with olive-fig relish as a delicious and appetizing meal.

4bf00ac974.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
For crust, add enough milk to egg yolk to measure 2/3 cup; set aside.
In medium bowl, combine flour and salt.
Cut in butter until crumbly.
With fork, stir in milk mixture until dough forms a ball.
You may need to add a few teaspoons more of milk if dough is still too dry.
Divide into halves.
Roll out half of the dough, on lightly floured surface, into a 15x10-inch rectangle.
Place on bottom of ungreased 15x10x1-inch jelly-roll pan.
For Filling, sprinkle cereal over top of crust; layer apples over cereal.
In small bowl, combine 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon and nutmeg.
Sprinkle over apples.
Roll remaining half of dough into a 15 1/2-10 1/2-inch rectangle; place over apples.
In small bowl, beat egg white with fork until foamy; brush over top crust.
In another small bowl, stir together 2 tablespoons granulated sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon; sprinkle over top crust.
Bake for 45 to 60 minutes or until lightly browned.
For Glaze, in small bowl, stir together all glaze ingredients.
Drizzle over top crust while still warm.
Cut into bars.
4bf00ac974.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the egg yolk, milk, flour, salt, and butter. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the crushed corn flakes, apples, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg to the mixture. Stir until well combined.
4. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
5. In a small mixing bowl, beat the reserved egg white until stiff peaks form. Fold the egg white into the apple mixture.
6. Sprinkle the powdered sugar and milk over the top of the mixture.
7. Bake the apple pie bars for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the apple pie bars to cool completely before cutting into bars and serving.

[/INST]

9a2f1c9bd7.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 9x13 pan.
Saute onion in butter til tender, don't brown.
Mix all ingredients together in bowl including onions and butter.
Pour potato mixture in pan and cover,bake aprox.
1 hour.
uncover last 10 minute.
9a2f1c9bd7.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the hash brown potatoes, cream of chicken or mushroom soup, sour cream, onion, pepper, and butter. Mix well.
3. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
4. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and the edges are golden brown.
5. Sprinkle the sharp cheddar cheese over the top of the potatoes. If desired, add broccoli, chicken, ground beef, or sausage as additional ingredients.
6. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Serve the Easy Cheesy Funeral Potluck Party Potatoes immediately.

[/INST]

c4ca98c041.gt:
In medium sized bowl, combine the cream cheese, picante sauce and pecans; blending well.
Take one slice of ham and spread a light layer of the cream cheese mixture onto the ham slice.
Beginning at one of the short ends, place a pickle and roll up tightly.
Once you get to the other end, place toothpicks in approximately 1/2 inch spaces.
I use 5 toothpicks per rollup.
Slice between toothpicks resulting in bite sized rollup.
Refrigerate until time to serve.
c4ca98c041.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ham, cream cheese, and picante sauce. Mix well.
3. Add the chopped pecans and mix until well combined.
4. Spread the mixture evenly over a large baking sheet or a foil-lined baking sheet.
5. Roll out the dough to cover the mixture.
6. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the dough is golden brown.
7. Remove the dough from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Carefully unroll the dough and carefully transfer the pickles to the center of the dough.
9. Carefully roll up the dough, enclosing the pickles.
10. Cut the roll into slices and serve.

[/INST]

7441333e16.gt:
Mix all ingredients well except almonds.
Form into ball and roll into almonds.
Makes 1 large or 2 small cheese balls.
7441333e16.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, drained pineapple, minced onions, minced green peppers, and Worcestershire sauce. Mix well.
3. Add the chopped maraschino cherries and mix until well combined.
4. Roll the mixture into small balls, about the size of a walnut.
5. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the balls in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
7. Remove the balls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the sliced almonds with a small amount of melted butter.
9. Once the balls have cooled, roll them in the almond mixture to coat them evenly.
10. Serve the Pineapple Cherry Cheese Balls immediately or store them in the refrigerator for later enjoyment.

[/INST]

57bca3c7cb.gt:
In a small sauce pot, start heating the milk.
Once warm, add Nutella and whisk together until smooth.
Add cocoa, cinnamon, vanilla and salt.
Whisk and cook until it starts to boil.
Pour into mugs and top with LOTS of marshmallows.
57bca3c7cb.pred:
To cook the Nutella Hot Cocoa, follow these steps:

1. In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat until it reaches a gentle simmer.
2. Add the Nutella, Hershey's Cocoa Special Dark, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract, and salt to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
3. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the marshmallows to the saucepan and stir until they are melted and fully incorporated.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
6. Serve the Nutella Hot Cocoa in a mug, garnished with a sprinkle of ground cinnamon, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Nutella Hot Cocoa!

06a62bd371.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease 9x13 inch baking dish.
Arrange potatoes over the bottom of the dish, and set aside.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add the garlic and onion; cook and stir until the onion is transparent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in 3 tablespoons butter until melted.
Sprinkle the flour, salt, and pepper over the onion mixture.
Cook and stir until mixture bubbles and thickens, about 2 minutes.
Continue to stir the flour mixture while gradually pouring in the milk and buttermilk, and return the mixture to boiling.
Stir in 3/4 cup Parmesan cheese; cook for 2 minutes until melted, and mixture is smooth.
Pour the mixture over the potatoes in the baking dish, stirring to coat evenly.
Bake in preheated oven for 1/2 hour, and stir.
Bake 1/2 hour longer, stir the potato mixture again, and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes more.
06a62bd371.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the cubed potatoes with the minced garlic, red onion, and a drizzle of olive oil. Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of paprika.
3. Spread the potatoes out on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and golden brown.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, 1/3 cup of the Parmesan cheese, and a pinch of salt.
5. In a large skillet, melt the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes, or until the mixture is smooth and bubbly.
6. Gradually pour the buttermilk mixture into the skillet, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Cook the sauce over medium heat for 5-7 minutes, or until it thickens and coats the potatoes evenly.
7. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the remaining 1/2 cup of Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the buttermilk Parmesan potatoes immediately, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

693873e2a3.gt:
Melt the butter in a medium saucepan and cook the onion gently over a low heat for 5 minutes until soft.
Add the pears and raisins and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the mixed spice, vinegars, sugar, cranberries, orange zest and juice and port, stir well and cook for another 10 minutes or so.
Season with a little salt and pepper.
Taste and then add more sugar or vinegar to your own taste - it may need some more, or you may be bang on!
This is best served warm.
693873e2a3.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the butter, sugar, and spices until well combined.
3. Add the diced pears and raisins to the bowl and toss to coat the fruit evenly with the butter mixture.
4. Transfer the fruit mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until the pears are tender and the chutney is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Stir in the cider vinegar and red onion, then pour the mixture over the cranberries in a separate bowl.
7. Allow the chutney to cool completely before serving.

[/INST]

629fc487a6.gt:
Heat butter in saucepan over medium heat until foaming.
Add onion and garlic to butter.
Cook until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Add curry powder, stirring to coat the onions well.
Add corn, stir, and continue to cook.
In a small bowl, add the coconut milk slowly to the cornstarch, stirring to prevent lumps.
Add this mixture to the corn mixture, stirring well.
Add remaining ingredients.
Lower heat, and cook for about 7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
The coconut milk should be mostly absorbed.
Serve warm.
629fc487a6.pred:
1. Heat the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
3. Pour in the curry powder and stir to coat the onion and garlic evenly. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the spices are fragrant.
4. Add the corn, cornstarch, coconut milk, and tomatoes to the saucepan. Stir to combine, then bring the mixture to a simmer.
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Reduce the heat to low and let the curry simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the corn is tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. Serve the curried corn over rice or with your favorite side dish. Enjoy!

[/INST]

400c858727.gt:
1.
Place cocoa in a medium saucepan.
Gradually whisk in milk until cocoa has dissolved.
Add chocolate chips and crushed peppermint; simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until chocolate and peppermint have melted, 8 to 10 minutes.
2.
Bring to a boil and immediately remove from heat.
Ladle into mugs and top with mini marshmallows.
Serve each with peppermint sticks, if desired.
400c858727.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine 13 cups of cocoa powder and 1 quart of skim milk. Whisk until smooth.
2. Add 1/2 cups of semisweet chocolate morsels and whisk until melted and smooth.
3. Gradually add 13 cups of crushed peppermints, whisking to combine.
4. Stir in 1 cup of mini marshmallows.
5. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it reaches the desired temperature.
6. Serve the Peppermint Hot Chocolate immediately.

[/SYS]

33a5002bf8.gt:
For carne asada:.
Marinate meat, then prepare ingredients for dressing, before grilling meat.
Plan to have flatbread warmed as you are ready to serve meat.
Marinate steaks in lime juice in a shallow glass dish for 1 minute.
Next add garlic, crushed red chile, black pepper, and Mexican oregano.
Marinate in refrigerator for at least 20 but no longer than 40 minutes.
While marinating meat:.
Combine all ingredients for Jalapeno Ranch Dressing in a 1 cup dish.
Mix well and refrigerate to let flavors blend.
Preheat oven to 170 degrees (or lowest heat setting).
Grill meat to desired doneness
Remove steaks from grill and let "rest" for 5 minutes.
Before meat is about to be taken off grill or while it is resting, add 1/3-1/2 cup of cheese on each flatbread.
Lay the cheese covered flatbreads directly onto middle oven rack and warm until cheese is melted.
Once meat has rested, cut meat against the grain into thin strips.
On each flatbread add desired amount of meat, 1-2 tablespoons jalapeno ranch dressing and about 1 T french fried onion strings.
Enjoy!
33a5002bf8.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. Season the flank steaks or round steaks with garlic powder, red pepper flakes, and black pepper.
3. Grill the steaks until they are cooked to your desired level of doneness, usually around 12-15 minutes for medium-rare.
4. Remove the steaks from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into thin strips.
5. In a large bowl, mix together the light mayonnaise, light sour cream, buttermilk ranch salad dressing mix, diced jalapeno peppers, jalapeno juice, and cilantro.
6. Add the cooked steak strips to the bowl and toss to combine.
7. Place the cooked steak strips on the flat bread, and top with the Mexican blend cheese.
8. Add French-fried onions as a garnish.

Enjoy your delicious Carne Asada Tacos!

a9c2e7ef04.gt:
Combine the flour and cocoa powder, and sift.
Preheat the oven for 170C.
Crush the chocolate and put into a bowl.
Add the butter, and melt them over a double-boiler or in a microwave.
(When you are using the double-boiler, remove the chocolate from it at this point.)
Add the eggs, and mix well quickly.
The mixture will become a little bit thick.
Add the sifted flour and cocoa powder, and mix well.
Pour the mixture into the ramekins.
Bake for 10-15 minutes in the oven at 170C.
When you bake too long, the inside won't be creamy, so bake until just the surface is cooked.
Once it's cooled, you can microwave for 20 seconds at 600 W, and the creaminess on the inside will come back.
Addendum: When you are making this using paper cups, bake for about 9 minutes.
Please check them occasionally.
Even when you are using baking ceramic crocks, check them after about 10 minutes of baking.
Once the surface is cooked, insert a bamboo skewer around the edge instead of the middle, and check the doneness.
If the edge is not liquidy, you can take it out from the oven.
a9c2e7ef04.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler or a heat-resistant bowl set over a pot of simmering water.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add the melted chocolate to the egg mixture and beat until well combined.
5. Gradually add the flour and cocoa powder, mixing until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
6. Grease a 23cm (9-inch) round cake pan with butter or margarine.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for about 10 minutes.
10. After 10 minutes, carefully remove the cake from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
11. Once the cake is fully cooled, use a sharp knife to slice it into equal portions.

Enjoy your delicious Creamy and Rich Easy Molten Chocolate Cake!

6976afc901.gt:
Cook Brussels sprouts in large saucepan of boiling water 10 to 12 min.
or until tender, adding cranberries to the cooking water for the last minute.
Drain Brussels sprouts mixture; return to pan.
Add dressing; toss to evenly coat.
6976afc901.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the trimmed Brussels sprouts with the dried cranberries, olive oil, and dressing.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet, and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until the Brussels sprouts are tender and slightly caramelized.
4. Serve the roasted Brussels sprouts with cranberries as a side dish or as part of a larger meal.

[/SYS]

f7582fba0b.gt:
STOCK:.
Combine the first 7 ingredients in a large pot and bring to a full boil.
Cook at the full boil for approx 1 hour.
Use a colander to drain.
Return liquid to the pot.
Dispose of the carcass.
Puree the cooked vegetables and set a side to be used as a thickener later.
SOUP:.
Combine the rest of the ingredients (except the crackers) in your large pot.
Bring to a boil.
Cook for 1 - 1 1/2 hours on medium heat - stirring occasionally.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Add the crackers approximately 15 - 20 minutes before serving.
The crackers dissolve and thicken your soup.
The crackers are used rather than flour or starch in order to freeze the soup without it separating and they do not take away any of the flavour.
f7582fba0b.pred:
To recreate the creamy lobster (seafood) vegetable soup, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the lobsters, onion, celery, and potatoes. Add enough water to cover the ingredients, and bring to a boil.
3. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 30 minutes or until the lobsters are cooked through.
4. Remove the lobsters from the pot and let them cool. Once cooled, remove the meat from the shells and set aside.
5. In a separate pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion, carrots, and celery, and cook until the vegetables are tender.
6. Add the imitation crabmeat or fresh crabmeat, chicken stock, vegetable stock, and heavy cream to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes.
7. Add the lobster meat to the pot, and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
8. Stir in the garlic powder, thyme, salt, and pepper.
9. Serve the soup in bowls, garnished with a sprinkle of sherry wine and a pinch of saltine crackers.

Enjoy your delicious creamy lobster (seafood) vegetable soup!

3f59ab0d36.gt:
Combine flour, salt, pepper in a ziplock bag .
Add chicken, shake to coat.
Heat oil and butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook until browned on all sides (about 5 mins).
Place in crockpot.
After removing chicken, put stock in the skillet and heat for 5 mins.
Pour into crockpot.
Add lemon juice, mushrooms and garlic to crockpot.
Cook on low for 2 hours.
Mix cornstarch and water, then add to crockpot.
Add remaining seasonings and capers.
Increase to high heat and cook for 30 mins.
Serve over rice and broccoli.
Top with parsley if desired.
3f59ab0d36.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and shallot powder, and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly.
3. Add the chicken strips to the skillet, and cook until they are browned on all sides.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a small amount of water to form a slurry.
6. Add the chicken stock, lemon juice, and the slurry to the skillet. Stir to combine, and bring the mixture to a boil.
7. Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
8. Remove the chicken from the skillet, and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. In a small bowl, mix the capers, Italian parsley, and cooked rice.
10. Return the chicken to the skillet, and stir in the caper mixture.
11. Cook for a few minutes, until the chicken is heated through and the flavors are combined.
12. Serve the Crockpot Chicken Piccata over cooked rice.

[/INST]

9f82ffde67.gt:
In a large saucepan, combine the water, shallots, garlic, thyme, peppercorns, kosher salt and oil.
Squeeze the lemon over the saucepan and add to the pan.
Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a microwave-safe bowl, mix the sugar and vinegar and microwave at high power for 1 minute; stir to dissolve the sugar.
Add a pinch of crushed red pepper and the green papaya.
Season with sea salt and black pepper and toss to coat.
In a small bowl, mash the lime juice into the avocado and season with sea salt and crushed red pepper.
Place the halibut in a deep, medium skillet, leaving some space between the fillets.
Strain enough of the aromatic poaching liquid over the fish to just cover it.
Simmer the halibut gently over very low heat just until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes.
Spoon the mashed avocado onto 4 plates and top with the halibut.
Using a slotted spoon, mound the papaya slaw on the fish and serve right away.
9f82ffde67.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. In a large saucepan, combine 8 cups of water, 4 shallots, thinly sliced, 6 garlic cloves, halved, 12 thyme sprigs, 2 tablespoons black peppercorns, 2 tablespoons kosher salt, and 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes.

2. While the sauce is simmering, prepare the green papaya slaw by peeling, seeding, and julienning 2 cups of green papaya. In a small bowl, mix 3 tablespoons of rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon of sugar, crushed red pepper, and 1 pound of green papaya. Season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

3. Once the sauce has simmered for 15 minutes, remove it from the heat and let it cool slightly. Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve, discarding the solids.

4. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Season the halibut fillets with salt and pepper. Place the fillets on a baking sheet and bake for about 12-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.

5. While the halibut is baking, mash the avocado in a small bowl using a fork or a potato masher. Season the avocado mash with salt and pepper to taste.

6. Once the halibut is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes. Then, slice the cooked halibut into thin pieces and serve it on a plate alongside the green papaya slaw.

Enjoy your delicious halibut with avocado mash and green papaya slaw!

594316d1ba.gt:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add rotini pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Place cooked pasta in a large bowl and combine with sliced baby carrots, broccoli, red onion, cauliflower, green pepper and peppercorn ranch dressing; mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for several hours.
594316d1ba.pred:
To prepare the meal, follow these steps:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
2. While the pasta is cooking, steam the baby carrots, broccoli, cauliflower, and green bell pepper in a steamer basket or on a steaming rack.
3. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and set it aside.
4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, steamed vegetables, and peppercorn Ranch salad dressing.
5. Toss the pasta mixture until it is well-coated with the dressing.
6. Serve the meal immediately, and enjoy!

5e36bf8c5c.gt:
Preheat a nonstick skillet over medium-low heat.
In a bowl whisk together the eggs, cream and powdered sugar.
Set aside.
Take 2 slices of the Texas toast and spread 1 tablespoon of Nutella on each one.
Sandwich them together and dip both sides of the sandwich in the custard mixture.
Grill on each side until brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove from heat and serve immediately with maple syrup while you repeat with the other ingredients.
5e36bf8c5c.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
2. Add the heavy cream and whisk until smooth.
3. Gradually add the powdered sugar, whisking until it is fully incorporated.
4. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
5. Spread a thin layer of Nutella on each slice of Texas Toast.
6. Dip each slice of Texas Toast in the egg mixture, making sure to coat both sides.
7. Place the coated slices on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake the French toast in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the toast is golden brown and the egg is set.
9. Serve the Nutella-Stuffed French Toast warm, and enjoy!

[/INST]

51d188ef9a.gt:
Heat large covered saucepot of salted water to boiling on high.
Add orzo and cook as label directs.
Meanwhile, in 12-inch skillet, heat oil on medium until hot.
Add grape tomatoes; cook 5 to 6 minutes or until skins split, shaking pan occasionally.
From lemon, grate 1 teaspoon peel and squeeze 1 tablespoon juice; set aside.
Remove skillet from heat.
Reserve 1/4 cup orzo cooking water; drain orzo.
Add orzo and cooking water to tomatoes in skillet; stir in lemon peel and juice, feta, olives, mint, and 1/4 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper.

f5d92fa57b.gt:
Heat the oven to 450 degrees F and arrange a rack in the middle.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place apples in a large bowl with raisins.
Whisk together sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and salt in a small bowl until combined.
Sprinkle over apples and raisins and toss to evenly coat.
Arrange a sheet of phyllo on a large, flat surface with the shorter side toward you.
Brush with melted butter and arrange another sheet on top.
Repeat, alternating butter and phyllo, until there are 6 layers, then brush the top layer with butter.
Evenly arrange apple-raisin mixture on phyllo, leaving a 1-1/2-inch border at the top and sides.
Begin to roll the phyllo away from you, folding in the sides as you roll.
When youve rolled up the entire pastry, brush any exposed phyllo with butter.
Place the strudel seam side down on the prepared baking sheet, brush again with butter (you may have a little left over), and cut 4 (1-inch) diagonal slits into the top just through the phyllo.
Bake until golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat to 350 degrees F and bake until the apples are knife tender and the juices are bubbling, about 30 to 40 minutes more.
Let cool at least 10 minutes before slicing.
f5d92fa57b.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the apple slices with the raisins, granulated sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and salt.
3. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
5. Carefully fold the egg whites into the melted butter mixture.
6. Pour the butter-egg white mixture over the apple mixture and toss to coat evenly.
7. Spread the apple mixture onto a large baking sheet.
8. Brush the edges of the phyllo sheets with melted butter.
9. Carefully roll out the phyllo sheets to form a large, even rectangle.
10. Place the apple mixture in the center of the phyllo rectangle.
11. Fold the phyllo over the apple mixture, creating a large, enclosed pouch.
12. Brush the top of the phyllo with melted butter.
13. Bake the strudel for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
14. Remove the strudel from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
15. Use a sharp knife to cut the strudel into wedges and serve.

[/INST]

This simple cinnamon-raisin-apple strudel recipe is perfect for a delicious, homemade dessert or snack. The combination of apples, raisins, and cinnamon creates a warm, comforting flavor profile that is both sweet and slightly tart. The phyllo dough adds a delicate, flaky texture to the dessert, making it a delightful treat for any occasion.

0062ecba72.gt:
COMBINE flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl.
Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition; gradually beat in flour mixture.
Stir in morsels and nuts.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
BAKE in preheated 375-degree [Fahrenheit] oven for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown.
Let stand for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.
PAN COOKIE VARIATION: PREPARE dough as above.
Spread into greased 15"x10" jelly-roll pan.
Bake in preheated 375-degree [Fahrenheit] oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool in pan on wire rack.
FOR HIGH ALTITUDE BAKING (>5,200 feet): INCREASE flour to 2 1/2 cups; add 2 teaspoonfuls water with flour; reduce both granulated sugar and brown sugar to 2/3 cup each.
Bake at 375 degrees Fahrenheit, drop cookies for 8 to 10 minutes and pan cookies for 17 to 19 minutes.
0062ecba72.pred:
To cook the Toll House Cookies, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Stir in the chopped nuts and semi-sweet chocolate morsels.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Toll House Cookies!

13a6ba0924.gt:
In a medium-sized pot, place dessicated coconut and water.
Mix and allow to soak for 1/2 an hour.
After 1/2 an hour, turn heat onto low and bring to a gentle simmer.
Simmer, covered, for 10 minutes.
Turn off heat and leave pot on element for 1/2 an hour.
After 1/2 an hour, transfer coconut mixture to blender or processor and process for 45 seconds.
Put a large sieve over a bowl and empty coconut mixture into it.
Press down hard on coconut solids with the back of a spoon to remove as much coconut milk as possible.
This method produces approximately 2 cups of coconut milk.
Can be made up to 2 days before use in a recipe and refrigerated, covered.
The milk will separate in the fridge, forming a creamy fat layer on top, and a thinner liquid layer underneath.
Not to worry, the fat layer will melt into the liquid when heated and form a lovely milk.
13a6ba0924.pred:

2. In a blender or food processor, blend the coconut until it reaches a smooth, creamy consistency.
3. Pour the coconut milk into a bowl or a large measuring cup.
4. If desired, add a pinch of salt to enhance the flavor.
5. Use the coconut milk as needed for your desired recipe.

These steps will help you create your own homemade coconut milk, allowing you to have a delicious and healthy alternative to store-bought coconut milk.

ee28b1bd5a.gt:

eca8b785b9.gt:

Add salt, pepper, parsley.
Add a layer of cream.
Spread the cream on the potatoes.
Add some grated cheese.
Repeat step 5 for as many layers as you have potatoes.
You might need to add cream or cheese.
On the final layer top with some parsley and a lot of cheese and bake for 45-60minutes.

4. In a small bowl, mix the butter, minced garlic, and cream cheese.
5. Spread the potato mixture evenly over the bottom of a large baking dish.
6. Pour the butter mixture over the potatoes, ensuring that it covers the entire surface.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 45-60 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden brown.
8. Remove the dish from the oven, let it cool for a few minutes, and then serve the Potatoes au Gratin.

<</SYS>>

This recipe for Potatoes au Gratin involves preparing a delicious dish using potatoes, heavy cream, grated cheese, parsley, garlic, cream cheese, and butter. The dish is baked in the oven until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden brown. The result is a creamy, flavorful, and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed as a side or main course.
