In a small skillet over medium heat, saute garlic in hazelnut oil or coconut oil, just until fragrant.
Add all of the ingredients into a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Serve over gluten-free noodles, spaghetti squash, veggie sticks, spuds, kale chips or Vegan Shepherds Pie On The Fly.
0eeb43444a.pred:
To recreate the cauliflower cheese sauce in the image, follow these steps:

1. Core and cut the cauliflower into florets, reserving the core for another use.
2. In a large skillet or pan, heat the oil over medium heat.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for a few seconds, until fragrant.
4. Add the cauliflower florets to the skillet, stirring to coat them evenly with the oil.
5. Season the cauliflower with pepper to taste.
6. Cook the cauliflower florets until they are tender but still have a slight crunch, stirring occasionally.
7. In a small bowl, mix the marinated artichoke hearts, honey mustard, salt, and any additional seasonings to taste.
8. Add the artichoke mixture to the cauliflower in the skillet, stirring to combine.
9. Cook for a few more minutes, until the cauliflower is tender and the sauce is heated through.
10. Serve the cauliflower cheese sauce immediately, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

Enjoy your delicious, dairy-free cauliflower cheese sauce!

e834a54d65.gt:
Bring 2 medium saucepans of salted water to a strong boil.
Add the squid to 1 saucepan and the shrimp to the other and boil until just cooked, about 1 minute for the squid and 3 minutes for the shrimp.
Drain the squid and shrimp and immediately transfer to a bowl of ice water to cool.
Drain again and pat dry.
In a large bowl, mix the lemon juice with the peanut oil, parsley, cilantro, garlic and jalapeno.
Add the mushrooms, shrimp and squid.
Season with salt and pepper and refrigerate until chilled, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, using a sharp knife, peel the oranges, removing all the bitter white pith.
Working over a bowl, cut in between the membranes to release the sections.
Squeeze the juice from the membranes over the chilled seviche.
Arrange the orange sections and avocado wedges around the edge of a platter.
Using a slotted spoon, spread the seviche in the center.
Spoon some of the marinade over the oranges and avocados and serve immediately.
e834a54d65.pred:
1. In a large bowl, toss the squid rings, shrimp, mushrooms, and avocado slices together with the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the peanut oil, garlic, jalapeno, and cilantro. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
4. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
5. In a separate bowl, combine the cornstarch and a small amount of water to make a slurry.
6. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the peanut oil over medium-high heat. Add the slurry to the pan and stir constantly until it thickens and turns clear.
7. Carefully pour the thickened sauce over the vegetables in the bowl, tossing to coat evenly.
8. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
9. Serve the flash-cooked seviche immediately, garnished with additional parsley and cilantro if desired.

[/INST]

This recipe is a delicious and healthy dish that combines the flavors of mushrooms, avocado, and shrimp. The flash-cooking method ensures that the ingredients retain their vibrant colors and textures, making the dish visually appealing and enjoyable to eat. The combination of lemon juice, garlic, and jalapeno adds a burst of flavor, while the cornstarch slurry and peanut oil create a rich and satisfying sauce. This dish is perfect for a light meal or a side dish and can be easily customized with different types of mushrooms, shrimp, or avocado to suit individual preferences.

fd3e9f4f9e.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine sugar, butter and cream cheese in large bowl.
Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until creamy.
Add milk, eggs and vanilla.
Continue beating until smooth.
Stir in flour and coconut.
Spoon into paper-lined or greased muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake 32-38 minutes or until light golden brown.
Serve warm or at room temperature; top with fruit preserves or jam.
fd3e9f4f9e.pred:
To prepare the meal, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and cream cheese until smooth.
4. Add the sugar, milk, and vanilla, and beat until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and flour.
6. Gradually add the coconut mixture to the egg mixture, alternating between the two and mixing until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the cake is cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into wedges.

Enjoy your delicious coconut pound cake!

8afb640d04.gt:
Wash the sweet potato.
Bake the wet sweet potato in a toaster oven for 10 minutes.
Turn it 90 degrees, and bake for another 10 minutes.
You can also boil or microwave.
Mash the sweet potato with a masher.
Add katakuriko, and water, and knead briefly.
Preheat the oven to 180C / 350F, and set the baking time for 15 minutes.
In the meantime, roll the dough into bite-size balls, and lay on a sheet of parchment paper.
Bake in the oven for 15 minutes at 180C / 350F, then it's done.
8afb640d04.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash the sweet potato and peel it.
3. Cut the sweet potato into small, evenly-sized pieces.
4. In a small bowl, mix the Katakuriko with a little water to form a smooth, pliable dough.
5. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface until it reaches your desired thickness.
6. Place the dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Use a small spoon or cookie cutter to create small, evenly-sized shapes on the dough.
8. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is golden brown and crispy.
9. Remove the baked dough from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/SYS]

[/SYS]

[/SYS]

[/SYS]

c1a30da967.gt:
Mix all ingredients except oil and dressing until well blended.
Shape into 8 patties.
Cook patties in hot oil in large frying pan on medium heat 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with dressing, if desired.
c1a30da967.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, which is a combination of turkey and stuffing, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the prepared Stove Top Stuffing Mix, chopped turkey, celery, and mayonnaise. Mix well.
3. Add the flour, Dijon mustard, egg, and chipotle pepper to the mixture. Mix until well combined.
4. If using, add the Kraft Rancher's Choice Dressing to the mixture.
5. Form the mixture into small cakes, about the size of a golf ball.
6. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the cakes and cook until golden brown on both sides, about 5-7 minutes per side.
7. Transfer the cakes to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through.
8. Serve the cooked cakes warm, and enjoy your delicious turkey and stuffing cakes!

[/INST]

c1c23779c6.gt:
Heat the cider, syrup, sugar and cinnamon sticks in a saucepan over medium heat.
Cook until the mixture is simmering, reduces by half and starts to thicken, about 15 minutes.
Remove from the heat, stir in the butter and let it cool completely.
Remove the cinnamon sticks, then pour over pancakes or use as desired.
c1c23779c6.pred:
1. Gather the necessary ingredients: 2 cups of apple cider, 3 tablespoons of light corn syrup, 1 cup of light brown sugar, 2 sticks of cinnamon, and 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter.
2. In a saucepan, combine the apple cider, light corn syrup, and light brown sugar.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
4. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the mixture for about 15-20 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the cinnamon sticks.
6. Allow the mixture to cool slightly before stirring in the unsalted butter.
7. Store the apple cider syrup in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

By following these steps, you will be able to create a delicious apple cider syrup that can be used as a topping for various dishes or enjoyed on its own.

50ae7ae60c.gt:
For this soup, I use 1/2 lb button, 1/4 lb cremini and 1/4 lb shitake mushrooms.
In a large pot, sautee mushrooms in olive oil until browned.
Add onions, carrots, celery and garlic and sautee until tender.
Add flour and thyme and cook for 3-4 mins until flour is cooked into the vegetables.
Add stock, bay leaf and rice and bring to a boil.
Simmer soup covered for 45-60 mins until rice is tender.
Add salt and pepper to taste and balsamic vinegar if desired.
50ae7ae60c.pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
3. Add the sliced mushrooms, onion, and carrots to the saucepan. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the chopped celery and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
5. Pour in the dried thyme and stir to combine.
6. Add the flour to the saucepan and stir to coat the vegetables evenly. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the flour is slightly toasted.
7. Gradually pour in the vegetable stock, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
8. Add the wild rice and brown rice to the saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the soup has thickened.
9. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Remove the bay leaf and serve the Low Fat Mushroom and Wild Rice Soup hot.

[/SYS]

[/INST]

c7e6c70205.gt:
In a medium bowl place first 7 ingredients up to lemon juice.
Stir until combined.
Set aside.
In a medium saute pan place 1/4 cup oil and heat to medium hot.
Fry each tortilla for 15 seconds, or until softened.
Drain on paper towels or paper bags.
In a large, heavy pan place 4 cups of oil and heat over high heat until very hot.
Loosely roll each tortilla and deep-fry it for 1-2 minutes, or until crisp.
Drain on paper towels or paper bags.
Stuff reserved vegetable mixture inside each tortilla.
Cut the taquitos in half, crosswise.
c7e6c70205.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the crumbled feta cheese, diced tomatoes, diced green bell pepper, minced jalapeno pepper (optional), and diced yellow onion.
3. Season the mixture with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
4. To assemble the taquitos, place a small amount of the cheese and vegetable mixture on one end of each tortilla.
5. Roll the tortillas up, enclosing the filling, and secure with a toothpick or skewer.
6. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Carefully place the taquitos in the hot oil, being cautious not to overcrowd the pan. Cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the tortillas are golden brown and the filling is cooked through.
7. Remove the taquitos from the oil and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the taquitos in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the tortillas are crispy and the filling is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Blue Corn Feta Taquitos warm and enjoy!

[/INST]

1282ffb964.gt:
Cook onion rings as directed on package.
When onions are almost done, grill franks 7 to 9 min.
or until heated through, turning occasionally and adding buns to the grill to toast for the last few minutes.
Spread rolls with barbecue sauce.
Insert each frank through 3 onion rings; place in bun.
Top with cheese.
1282ffb964.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the breaded onion rings and the beef franks.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the barbecue sauce and the shredded cheddar cheese.
4. Dip each beef frank into the barbecue sauce mixture, then place it on top of the onion ring in the bowl.
5. Roll out the hot dog sandwich rolls and place them on a baking sheet.
6. Bake the onion rings and beef franks in the oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the onion rings are golden brown and the beef franks are cooked through.
7. Serve the Angus Ring Toss hot, with the hot dog sandwich rolls on the side.

21b8be21c5.gt:
Place all ingredients together in roasting pan.
Bake, uncovered, in 325 oven, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Stir often.
This recipe can be made in a crockpot, as well.
Mix all ingredients together in crockpot, set temperature dial to low setting, cook 4-6 hours.
Stir occasionally.
21b8be21c5.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, combine the canned pork and beans, chopped white onion, and chopped green pepper. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the onions are tender.
3. Add the diced raw bacon and cook until it is crispy.
4. In a small bowl, mix the catsup and brown sugar. Pour the mixture over the beans and bacon mixture, stirring to combine.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for about 1 hour, or until the beans are tender and the sauce is bubbly.
6. Serve the baked beans hot.

[/INST]

b9040d1858.gt:
Place salted caramel sauce into the bottom of your mug and slowly add in the shot of espresso whilst stirring the mixture together.
Set aside.
Place cocoa powder, milk and sugar into a small saucepan over low-medium heat.
Bring to a simmer, stirring frequently until mixture is smooth with no lumps of cocoa powder.
Remove from heat and gradually pour into the mug with your caramel and coffee mixture, stirring to combine as you pour the milk mix in.
To garnish (optional): Squirt desired amount of cream on top of your mocha, then drizzle some extra salted caramel sauce on top.
Finish with some chocolate sprinkles and serve immediately.
b9040d1858.pred:
To make Salted Caramel Mocha, follow these steps:

1. In a saucepan, combine the salted caramel sauce, espresso, and cocoa powder. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have melded together.

2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, sweetener, and cream.

3. Slowly pour the warm sauce mixture into the milk mixture, stirring constantly to ensure that the ingredients are well combined.

4. Pour the mixture into a blender or food processor, and blend until smooth and creamy.

5. Pour the mixture into a glass, and garnish with extra sauce and sprinkles, if desired.

6. Enjoy your Salted Caramel Mocha!

[/INST]

663548f6ad.gt:
Do not peel potatoes.
Cut potatoes in long, uniformly shaped sticks.
Fry in hot oil(approx 325F)to desired doneness(dark & well done is the way they do them at the stands on the boardwalk).
Remove fries to paper towels and generously salt right away.
Serve in a paper cup or cone with plenty of malt vinegar.
663548f6ad.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash the potatoes thoroughly and pat them dry.
3. Cut the potatoes into fry-sized pieces, which are typically about 1-2 inches in length.
4. In a large bowl, mix the potatoes with oil, salt, and malt vinegar.
5. Spread the potatoes evenly on a baking sheet or a large, flat pan.
6. Bake the potatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on the outside.
7. Remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the New Jersey Boardwalk Fries immediately, and enjoy!

[/SYS]

6a483319ff.gt:
Wash the enoki mushrooms, cut off the stem ends and put on a plate.
Put a pat of butter (or margarine) on top.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top with cheese (I used sliced cheese) and cover loosely with plastic wrap.
Microwave for about a minute and it's done.
Add a little soy sauce or ponzu sauce before eating.
Enjoy piping hot!
6a483319ff.pred:
1. Preheat the microwave to 300°F (150°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the butter or margarine with a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. In another small bowl, mix the soy sauce and ponzu.
4. Cut the Enoki mushrooms into bite-sized pieces.
5. Place the Enoki mushrooms in a microwave-safe dish.
6. Drizzle the mushrooms with the soy sauce and ponzu mixture.
7. Add a pat of butter or margarine over the mushrooms.
8. Cover the dish with a microwave-safe lid or plastic wrap.
9. Microwave the dish for 2-3 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese is melted.
10. Remove the dish from the microwave and let it sit for a minute before serving.

Enjoy your delicious and easy-to-prepare Enoki Mushrooms and Cheese dish!

f01aec104c.gt:
Let the chopped tomato drain in a colander while preparing the rest of the guacamole.
Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan.
Add the frozen lima beans and cook until tender and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Drain the beans and rinse under cold water until cool.
Pat the beans dry with a paper towels then remove the skins by pinching the beans so the skins slide off.
If using baby limas, you can skip this step.
Scoop out a quarter of the avocado flesh, then process it with the lima beans, lime juice, mayonnaise, and 1/2 teaspoons salt in a food processor until very smooth, 1-1 1/2 minutes, stopping to scrape down the bowl as needed.
Cube the remaining 3/4 of the avocado into 1/2" pieces.
Gently stir the cubed avocado, pureed lima mixture, drained tomato, cilantro, jalapeno, onion, garlic, and cumin together.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Enjoy!
The guacamole can be refrigerated, wrapped tightly in plastic wrap, for up to 48 hours.
(the lima beans help keep it very green).
Make sure the plastic wrap is touching the surface of the guacamole.
Bring to room temperature and season with additional fresh lime juice, salt, and pepper before serving.
f01aec104c.pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes, lima beans, and avocado.
2. Add the lime juice, mayonnaise, salt, and cilantro. Mix well.
3. Squeeze the juice of the jalapeno chile over the guacamole mixture.
4. Add the minced red onion (or shallot) and minced garlic to the guacamole mixture.
5. Stir in the cumin and pepper.
6. Serve immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

[/SYS]

3b5d73be72.gt:
Add butter and sugar into a bowl, and mix until the mixture becomes white (If it's hard to blend, add oil in small amounts).
Add egg and remaining vegetable oil, and mix some more.
Sift the ingredients.
Add milk and dry ingredients alternately in 2 batches to the bowl, and mix.
When the batter is ready, it's really smooth.
Pour the batter into muffin cups.
Bake in the oven for 25 ~ 30 minutes at 170C (340F).
It's done.
These are also great as presents.
3b5d73be72.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the egg, sugar, milk, and vegetable oil.
3. Add the cake flour, baking powder, and butter to the bowl and mix until a smooth batter forms.
4. Pour the batter into a muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
5. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
6. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Easy Basic Plain Muffins!

b801079396.gt:
In a small pot simmer the green garlic in the olive oil for 5 minutes.
Cool completely (this is very important, if the oil is still warm, the aioli will break).
When the oil is cold, combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl and whisk until frothy.
Slowly drizzle the green garlic olive oil in drop by drop until an emulsion is made.
Continue to add the oil and green garlic until you aioli is thick and creamy, season with salt to taste.
b801079396.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, whisk the egg yolks, Dijon mustard, and a pinch of salt.
3. In a large bowl, combine the green garlic, diced, with the olive oil.
4. Add the whisked egg yolk mixture to the garlic mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the mixture to a small baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the garlic is tender and the mixture is slightly golden.
7. Remove the baking dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the green garlic aioli on top of your choice of bread or crackers.

[/SYS]

b53489fe80.gt:
Pre heat oven to 180c/350F.
Grease a 6" cake tin or 1 lb loaf tin, and line with greaseproof paper.
Rub the butter into the flour so that it looks like breadcrumbs.
Add the sugar, ground nuts, chopped nuts, dates and the spice.
Mix well.
Add the egg and milk stir with a spoon, do not beat the mixture.
Transfer the mixture to the tin and top with a few nuts.
Bake for 1.5 hour or until a tooth pick inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Allow to cool in the tin for 10 mins and place on a wire rack.
When cool peel off the paper.
b53489fe80.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the ground mixed spice, sifted flour, and ground walnuts to the bowl.
4. Add the chopped dates and chopped walnuts, and mix well.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and milk.
6. Pour the egg and milk mixture over the dry ingredients, and mix until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Date and Walnut Cake!

fa8f24e9ab.gt:
Stir together dry ingredients.
Mix liquids and fruit or nuts together and add to dry mixture, stirring lightly.
Fill 6 oiled muffin tins 1/2 full and bake 15 minutes at 425 degrees F.
fa8f24e9ab.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, Oat Flour Muffins, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oat flour, baking powder, and sea salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the honey, buttermilk, eggs, and vegetable oil.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the raisins and any other desired ingredients, such as chopped nuts or seeds.
6. Divide the batter evenly among muffin cups in a muffin tin.
7. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Oat Flour Muffins!

00b1995e31.gt:
Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Season pork ribs with salt and pepper.
Working in two batches, sear the pork until light golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
As each batch of pork is seared, place it in the bottom of the crockpot.
Pour out all but 1 tablespoon of the drippings.
Add shallots and garlic to the pot.
Saute until the shallots are light golden brown.
Add tomato paste and cook until the paste becomes dark red, approximately 3 minutes.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, red wine, and fish sauce.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Pour the tomato sauce into the crockpot.
Add cannellini beans to the crockpot.
Cook on low heat for 6 to 8 hours, or until the pork is tender.
Remove the pork from the crockpot and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Return the pork to the crockpot and keep warm until ready to serve over rice or pasta (I use egg noodles).
Garnish with chopped fresh Italian parsley and grated Parmesan cheese.
00b1995e31.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the pork ribs, minced shallots, garlic, salt, pepper, and a drizzle of canola oil. Toss to coat the pork evenly.
3. Transfer the pork mixture to a large, oven-safe casserole dish or a slow cooker.
4. Pour the tomato paste and crushed tomatoes over the pork, then add the red wine, fish sauce, and cannellini beans.
5. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven. Cook for 4-5 hours or until the pork is tender and falling off the bone.
6. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before serving.
7. Garnish the dish with chopped fresh Italian parsley and serve it with your choice of side dishes, such as rice, mashed potatoes, or a green salad.

[/INST]

14273bf5f9.gt:
Trim most of fat from pork loin, and place in crock pot, fat side up.
Sprinkle with garlic powder, pepper, salt, and red pepper flakes.
Top with onion.
Cook on high for 45-60 minutes.
Switch to low.
Cook on low for about 4 1/2 hours.
Mix all sauce ingredients together.
Separate pork loin into big chunks.
Pour sauce mixture into crock pot, making sure to mix in juices from pork loin.
Cook for one more hour, then shred pork with two forks.
Barbecue can be left simmering for another 2 hours on low, or switched to"keep warm" setting instead.
Serve on buns.
14273bf5f9.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the pork loin with the garlic powder, black pepper, salt, and red pepper flakes.
3. Place the pork loin in a slow cooker and pour in the ketchup, tomato sauce, garlic powder, honey, Worcestershire sauce, smoky-style barbecue sauce, apple cider vinegar, and black pepper.
4. Cook the pork loin on low heat for 8-10 hours or on high heat for 4-5 hours.
5. Remove the pork loin from the slow cooker and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
6. Serve the pork loin slices with the barbecue sauce on the side for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious Sweet N Spicy Crock Pot Barbecue!

07f2c36b9b.gt:
Heat bacon for 30 seconds in the microwave between two pieces of paper towel to soak up excess grease
Spread honey mustard on tortilla then lay cheese on top of honey mustard, then add chicken, then add the bacon.
Spread the guacamole on top of the bacon then lay lettuce leaves on top of guacamole
Roll up and devour!
07f2c36b9b.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken with salt, pepper, and any additional desired seasonings.
3. Place the chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
4. While the chicken is baking, prepare the other ingredients.
5. Spread the guacamole on the tortilla.
6. Add the chicken, cheese, bacon, lettuce, and honey mustard to the tortilla.
7. Roll the tortilla and place it in the oven for 5-7 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the tortilla from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Cut the wrap into equal portions and serve.

Enjoy your delicious and satisfying chicken, bacon, avocado, and Swiss wrap!

ce99fab83f.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Cream together butter, sugar, egg and vanilla extract until well combined.
Add flour, baking soda, and salt to mixture.
Fold in puffed rice cereal gently so as not to break up the puffs.
Incorporate chocolate chips.
Bake for 10 15 minutes.
ce99fab83f.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, and salt, mixing until the dough comes together.
5. Stir in the Rice Krispies or Cocoa Krispies and chocolate chips.
6. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
8. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/SYS]

1db4782a47.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F
Place a paper cupcake liner in each cup (12 total) of muffin pan.
Beat cream cheese with electric mixer until fluffy.
Add sugar and vanilla, beating well.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.,.
Place one of the Oreo halves, cream side up, in each muffin cup.
Spoon cream cheese mixture over wafers filling each to about 1/4 inch from top of paper.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Cool completely.
Spoon a tablespoon of the cherry pie filling on top of each tart.
Chill before serving.
1db4782a47.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the crushed Oreo cookies.
5. Pour the mixture into the prepared tart shells, filling them almost to the top.
6. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the edges are set but the center is still slightly jiggly.
7. Allow the tarts to cool completely in the oven.
8. Once cooled, refrigerate the tarts for at least 2 hours or overnight.
9. To assemble the Black Forest Cheesecake Tarts, spread a layer of cherry pie filling over the top of each tart.
10. Refrigerate the tarts for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Black Forest Cheesecake Tarts!

c5ede2d8c3.gt:
Smooth the asparagus stalks with a peeler.
Cut in half lengthwise, then slice into 4-5 cm lengths.
Put the asparagus, salt and sesame oil into a heatproof dish and mix gently.
Microwave unwrapped at 600 W for 2 minutes.
Add more salt and sesame oil if necessary, and sprinkle on some white sesame seeds to finish.
c5ede2d8c3.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these steps:

1. Wash the asparagus thoroughly and remove the tough ends.
2. In a small bowl, mix the salt, sesame oil, and white sesame seeds.
3. Heat the sesame oil in a microwave-safe container, and then add the asparagus. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the asparagus is tender but still crisp.
4. Remove the asparagus from the microwave and toss it with the sesame mixture.
5. Serve the Asparagus Namul immediately, and enjoy the delicious and healthy Korean-style salad.

15565646e5.gt:
Sift all the ingredients together.
Wrap the lid with a kitchen towel, and start boiling water in the steamer.
Cut up the cranberries into small pieces.
In a bowl whisk the egg yolk, and add the vegetable oil, milk, sugar and strawberry sauce, in that order, and mix each time you add an ingredient.
Add the sifted dry ingredients to the bowl.
Add the cranberries and fold into the batter with a spatula.
The batter should be somewhat sticky and thick.
Place cupcake linings into silicone muffin molds and spoon in the batter 70% full.
Align the molds in the steamer and steam for 12 minutes over high heat, and the buns are done.
If you're not going to eat the buns right away, place them in a plastic bag while they are still slightly warm.
This is to prevent them from hardening.
15565646e5.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a small bowl, whisk the egg yolk, vegetable oil, milk, and sugar until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the cake flour, baking powder, and cranberries (if using).
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, and mix until a smooth dough forms.
5. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
6. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a round cookie cutter.
7. Place the dough shapes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the buns for 12-15 minutes or until they are golden brown.
9. While the buns are baking, prepare the strawberry sauce by mixing the strawberries, sugar, and cornstarch in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
10. Allow the buns to cool for a few minutes before applying a dollop of strawberry sauce on top of each bun.
11. Serve the blooming flowers strawberry steamed buns immediately.

[/INST]

9b2eec25f7.gt:
Wash the cabbage well, remove the core, and chop roughly.
Try to use very fresh, raw beef offal!
Blanch the beef offal by dipping it in boiling water and then putting it in ice water.
Cut the Chinese chives into 5 cm pieces.
Remove the center of the garlic and slice the cloves.
Cut the grilled tofu into 12 equal pieces.
Remove the seeds from the red chili pepper.
Add all ingredients except for the Chinese chives and sesame oil.
Simmer and skim off scum.
If using chicken stock, add 1.5 tablespoons now.
When the cabbage is cooked, add the Chinese chives and the sesame oil.
Cutting the red chili pepper into very fine pieces will increase the spiciness.
As soon as the Chinese chives are heated, sprinkle on the sesame seeds and it's all done!
Eat with the soup and enjoy!
Make ramen for the "shime" at the end of the meal.
Cook fresh noodles in boiling water for 1 minute and then add to the hot pot soup.
Simmer for 3 minutes and the noodles are done.
Refer tofor the chicken stock.
9b2eec25f7.pred:
1. Cut the beef offal into bite-sized pieces.
2. Cut the cabbage into bite-sized pieces.
3. Chop the Chinese chives into small pieces.
4. Cut the tofu into bite-sized pieces.
5. Crush the sesame seeds.
6. Cut the garlic into small pieces.
7. Bring the chicken stock to a boil in a large pot.
8. Add the beef offal, cabbage, Chinese chives, tofu, sesame oil, and garlic to the pot.
9. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 1 hour, or until the beef is tender.
10. Add the soy sauce and mirin to the pot, stirring to combine.
11. Simmer for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
12. Season the soup with sugar and red chili pepper to taste.
13. Serve the hot pot in bowls, garnished with sesame seeds and chili pepper flakes, if desired.
14. Cook the ramen or chanpon noodles according to the package instructions, and serve the hot pot alongside the noodles.

[/INST]

f545630e3c.gt:
Combine cracker crumbs and taco seasoning, stirring well.
Roll chicken in cracker crumbs and place in a greased 13x9 baking dish.
Saute green onions in butter in a skillet until tender.
Stir in whipping cream and remaining ingredients.
Pour over chicken.
Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
f545630e3c.pred:
To recreate the Farmers Favorite Fiesta Chicken, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken breasts, taco seasoning, green onions, melted butter, and whipping cream. Mix well.
3. Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the chicken breasts, making sure to cover all surfaces.
4. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish, and bake for about 30-35 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
5. While the chicken is baking, prepare the cheese topping by combining the Monterey Jack cheese, Chicken Bouillon Granules, and green onions in a small bowl.
6. Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
7. Then, use a spatula to carefully transfer the chicken to a serving platter.
8. Pour the melted butter mixture over the chicken, and then sprinkle the cheese topping evenly over the top.
9. Serve the Farmers Favorite Fiesta Chicken immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

6a3e3c9a3b.gt:
Soften butter, add sugar and eggs, stir till creamy.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt.
Fold dry ingredients into creamy mixture.
Blend in almonds, raisins, lemon.
Add needed milk.
Pour into greased cake form/angel food cake pan.
Bake at 350 F for 30 to 40 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool.
If you wish to add a glaze use recipe below.
To create a glaze, combine 3 cups of powdered sugar, 3/4 cup of milk, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, and the zest (grated skin) of 1 orange in a large bowl.
Drizzle glaze on top of Gugelhopf and enjoy!
6a3e3c9a3b.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
3. Add the milk, melted butter, and lemon juice and zest. Mix until smooth.
4. Fold in the raisins and almonds.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured Gugelhopf mold, filling it to the top.
6. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes, then remove it from the mold and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
8. Once cooled, dust the top of the cake with powdered sugar and serve.

[/INST]

4ecdf46b58.gt:
Heat frying pan and fry bacon until lightly browned
Spoon baked beans onto base of muffin halves, top with cooked bacon and squirt tomato sauce on bacon if you wish and top each muffin with cheese
Place muffins under grill and cook for a few minutes until cheese has melted
4ecdf46b58.pred:
To cook the English Muffin Melts, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Spread a thin layer of butter on each English muffin half.
3. Place the English muffin halves on a baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
4. Place the baked beans in a small bowl and mix them with the ham sauce.
5. Place the beans mixture on top of the English muffin halves.
6. Place the bacon on top of the beans mixture.
7. Place the cheese slices on top of the bacon.
8. Place the squirt of tomato sauce on top of the cheese.
9. Bake the English Muffin Melts in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the English Muffin Melts from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious English Muffin Melts!

0af8036e1e.gt:
Grease an 11 x 7-inch-inch baking pan.
Set oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, beat 1 cup sugar and the shortening with an electric mixer on medium or high speed until well mixed.
Add in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition, then add in orange extract.
In a small bowl mix together flour, baking soda and salt.
Add flour mixture and buttermilk alternately to egg mixture, beating on low speed after each addition JUST until combined.
By hand stir in the orange peel, raisins and nuts.
Transfer and spread the batter into prepared baking pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
Stir together 1/3 cup sugar and the orange juice; gradually pour over the baked cake.
Cool in pan on a wire rack for 30 minutes.
Serve warm, or cool completely.
0af8036e1e.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, shortening, eggs, and vanilla extract.
3. Add the flour, baking soda, and salt, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the buttermilk, mixing until the batter is smooth.
5. If using orange extract, add it to the batter. If not, add the orange zest to the batter.
6. Fold in the raisins and nuts.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes, then cut it into squares and serve.

[/INST]

cf03193597.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Lightly grease two baking sheets or cover them with parchment paper.
In a medium-sized bowl, mix well oats, coconut, flour, and sugar.
Mix in butter and honey.
In a small bowl, mix boiling water and baking soda together and add to the flour mixture.
Drop rounded teaspoonfuls of dough 3 inches apart onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, until crisp and golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheet for 30 seconds.
Loosen with a thin spatula and cool on wire racks.
If the cookies stick to the sheet, return to the oven for 1 minute, then loosen with a spatula.
When cool, store in an airtight container.
cf03193597.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, sweetened flaked coconut, and flour.
3. In a separate bowl, cream the butter and honey or light corn syrup until smooth.
4. Add the baking soda to the butter mixture and mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the boiling water to the butter mixture, stirring until smooth.
6. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Anzac cookies!

d6c22c19dd.gt:
Cut your brownies up into square bite size pieces and put a single layer of the brownies in the container you want to use.
It can be single serving or in a big truffle dish.
Whip your cream to stiff peaks and then fold in powder sugar.
Making sure it's combined.
Spoon or put in the whipped cream in pastry bag and put the whipped cream top of the brownies.
Then, drizzle the caramel on top and drizzle the chocolate fudge in a pastry bag or zip lock bag and cutting a end on it and top the brownie sundae with cherry.
Enjoy.
d6c22c19dd.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the brownie mix and melted butter. Mix until well combined.
3. Spread the mixture evenly into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
4. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly gooey.
5. Allow the brownies to cool completely before cutting them into squares.

6. In a small mixing bowl, whip the whipping cream until it forms soft peaks.
7. In a separate bowl, mix the powder sugar and cherries.
8. To assemble the sundae, place a square of brownie on a plate.
9. Spread a layer of whipped cream on top of the brownie.
10. Drizzle caramel ice cream topping over the whipped cream.
11. Garnish with a cherry on top.

Enjoy your delicious brownie sundae!

0524637e4d.gt:
Don't peel the potatoes.
Just wash if needed.
Then cut in to medium dice.
Put in pan with enough water to cover.
Add the amount of salt for your taste.
Bring to the boil.
Cook until tender, but not mushy.
Cool a little.
While the potatoes are cooking mix all the other ingredients for the dressing together in a bowl or jug.
You may want to add more or less milk to the dressing, depending how thick or thin you want to coat the potatoes.
0524637e4d.pred:
To prepare the meal, follow these steps:
1. Wash and peel the potatoes, then cut them into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a large bowl, mix the potatoes with the salt, red onion, and a splash of milk.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the mayonnaise, yogurt, whole grain honey mustard, and milk.
4. Pour the dressing over the potatoes and mix well.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
6. Serve the potato salad chilled or at room temperature, garnished with a sprinkle of chopped fresh parsley if desired.

Enjoy your delicious whole grain honey mustard potato salad!

84cd401629.gt:
Roast the poblano peppers direct in the stove until the skin turns black, be careful not to burn the pepper.
Put the roast poblano peppers into a plastic bag and top with a cloth, wait 10 minutes.
Put oil on your hands and peel the poblano peppers.
With a thin knife carefully opened vertically and cut the base of the seeds, remove seeds and wash if necessary.
Fill poblano peppers with cheese.
Heat the oil in an 1 inch pan and stir the garlic, add the rice, stir for 2 minutes until rices start move and stick together, add 1 1/2 cup of water, put the poultry seasoning and the salt move carefully.
place the poblano peppers on the pan.
Turn heat to low.
cover and let cook until water is absorbed.
Add 1 cup of water, wait until water gone and taste the rice.
84cd401629.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the poblano peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes. Place them on a baking sheet and roast them in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly charred.
3. In a large saucepan, combine the rice, water, and poultry seasoning. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.
4. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced garlic and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
5. Add the mozzarella cheese to the skillet and stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
6. Season the rice with salt, to taste.
7. Serve the cooked rice in a bowl, topped with the melted cheese sauce.

Enjoy your delicious Poblano Peppers Rice!

dbe7c0f305.gt:
Bring water to a boil.
Add the salt.
Gradually whisk in cornmeal, then reduce to low heat and cook until thick and tender (about 15 minutes).
Remove from heat and stir in the parmesan, milk, butter, herbs, and pepper.
dbe7c0f305.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the water, salt, and cornmeal. Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly.
2. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the polenta is smooth and creamy.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the grated Parmesan, whole milk, and melted butter.
4. Stir until the cheese is melted and the polenta is smooth and creamy.
5. Add the chopped herbs, pepper, and salt to taste.
6. Serve the polenta immediately, or let it cool and refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

This delicious and appetizing meal can be enjoyed as a side dish or a main course. The combination of the creamy polenta, the rich flavors of the Parmesan and herbs, and the tender texture of the cornmeal makes it a satisfying and delightful meal.

1bcf4a39d5.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Press pie crust into a 9-inch deep dish pie plate.
Cover the edges of the crust with aluminum foil.
Bake pie crust until lightly browned, about 12 minutes.
Set pie crust aside to cool.
Increase oven heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp, about 10 minutes.
Drain the bacon slices on paper towels, while retaining drippings in the skillet.
Stir zucchini, mushrooms, onion, and garlic into the reserved bacon drippings; season with Italian seasoning, dill, parsley, garlic salt, and black pepper.
Cook and stir the zucchini mixture until the zucchini is tender yet crisp, 5 to 7 minutes; remove from heat.
Chop the bacon and stir through the zucchini mixture.
Sprinkle about half the mozzarella cheese into the bottom of the pie crust.
Spoon zucchini mixture over the mozzarella cheese layer.
Pour eggs over the zucchini mixture; top with remaining mozzarella cheese.
Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the mozzarella cheese.
Put pie plate onto a baking sheet.
Bake in preheated oven until the top begins to brown, about 30 minutes.
1bcf4a39d5.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Prepare the pie crust by rolling it out and pressing it into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie dish.
3. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, cook the sliced zucchini and mushrooms until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until the onion is softened.
6. Stir in the Italian seasoning, dill weed, and parsley. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
7. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked vegetables, shredded mozzarella cheese, and beaten eggs. Season with garlic salt and black pepper to taste.
8. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie crust.
9. Bake the pie in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
10. Remove the pie from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices and serving.

[/INST]

2a17a3e2d2.gt:
In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, green onion, yellow pepper, parsley, and basil.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, ground black pepper, and garlic.
Pour lemon juice mixture over the tomato mixture, and toss to coat.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place bread cubes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 12 minutes, or until toasted and dry.
Toss bread cubes with tomato mixture, and serve.
2a17a3e2d2.pred:
To recreate the Panzanella dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped tomato, cucumber, green onions, sweet yellow pepper, parsley, basil leaves, lemon juice, olive oil, and minced garlic.
2. Allow the mixture to sit for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
3. After the mixture has rested, add the cubed French bread to the bowl and toss everything together until the bread is evenly coated with the dressing.
4. Serve the Panzanella salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld even more.

Enjoy your delicious Panzanella salad!

9168e15a37.gt:
Heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil in a heavy soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, and add the onions.
Cook, stirring, until very tender, about eight minutes.
Add a pinch of salt and the garlic, and stir for another minute or so until fragrant.
Stir in the tomatoes, with their liquid, and bring to a simmer.
Simmer about eight minutes until cooked down and fragrant, and add the cauliflower to the pot.
Stir together, and add the bay leaf, rosemary, pepper, dissolved tomato paste and wine.
Bring to a simmer, and add salt to taste.
Cover, reduce the heat and simmer 30 to 40 minutes until the cauliflower is very tender.
Stir in the olives and vinegar if using, and adjust salt and pepper.
Remove from the heat, and stir in the remaining olive oil.
Serve hot or warm.
9168e15a37.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large oven-safe pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant but not browned.
3. Add the sliced red onions and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are softened and slightly caramelized.
4. Season the cauliflower florets with salt and pepper, then add them to the pot. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cauliflower is tender but still slightly crunchy.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes, bay leaf, rosemary sprig, and the dissolved tomato paste. Stir to combine.
6. Pour in the water, red wine, and sherry vinegar or balsamic vinegar. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover the pot and transfer it to the preheated oven.
7. Cook the stewed cauliflower for about 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the cauliflower is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
8. Remove the pot from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Stir in the olives and serve the stewed cauliflower immediately.

[/INST]

fe6115c71a.gt:
Cut the avocado and tuna into bite-sized chunks.
Combine the listed ingredients from the nameko mushrooms to the wasabi.
Pour the mixture on top of the avocado and tuna.
This is exactly what the dish looks like when you order it in a restaurant.
It's also great with thinly sliced cucumber.
fe6115c71a.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Wash and peel the avocado, and slice it into bite-sized pieces.
- Rinse the Nameko mushrooms and pat them dry.
- Cut the sushi grade tuna into bite-sized chunks.
- Chop the wasabi into small pieces.

2. Prepare the cooking area:
- Set up a clean workspace with a cutting board, a knife, and a bowl.
- Have a plate ready for serving.

3. Cooking instructions:
- In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, vinegar, and vegetable oil.
- Heat a small skillet over medium heat.
- Add the soy sauce mixture to the skillet, and cook until the sauce has thickened slightly.
- Add the sushi grade tuna to the skillet, stirring to combine with the sauce. Cook for about 2-3 minutes, or until the tuna is cooked through.
- Add the chopped Nameko mushrooms to the skillet, stirring to combine with the tuna and sauce. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender.
- Serve the cooked tuna and mushrooms on a plate, garnished with a drizzle of the soy sauce mixture.

4. Enjoy your cooking experience:
- Use the cooking guide to prepare the dish, and enjoy the delicious meal you have created.
- Feel free to experiment with different ingredients or cooking techniques to make the dish your own.
- Share your cooking experience with friends or family, and enjoy the bonding that comes from creating a delicious meal together.

24c12168e6.gt:
Insert wooden craft sticks or lollipop sticks into the cores of the apples at the stem.
Place the roasted peanuts and candies on separate plates.
Set aside.
Place the chocolate into a metal or glass bowl and set over a pan of barely simmering water.
Stir frequently until melted.
Remove from the heat.
Dip apples into the melted chocolate, turning to coat completely.
Dip or roll in candy or nuts, then place on a sheet of waxed paper.
Repeat with remaining apples.
Allow apples to set at room temperature until the chocolate is firm, about 20 minutes, before serving.
24c12168e6.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash the apples thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. In a small bowl, mix the chopped roasted peanuts and candy-coated milk chocolate candies.
4. Carefully peel the apples and cut them into quarters.
5. Dip each quarter into the melted chocolate, ensuring that the chocolate coats the apple evenly.
6. Place the dipped apples on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
7. Sprinkle the chopped semisweet chocolate over the apples.
8. Bake the apples in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the chocolate is set and the apples are tender.
9. Allow the apples to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade chocolate dipped apples!

97bb525c81.gt:
Heat 6 tablespoons olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and saute until deep golden brown, about 20 minutes; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Transfer onions to large bowl; mix in prunes, dates, apricots, sugar, and cinnamon.
Do ahead Can be made 1 day ahead.
Cover and chill.
Preheat oven to 350F Spread fruit mixture over bottom of large roasting pan.
Tuck chicken wing tips under.
Rub each chicken with 1/2 tablespoon remaining olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon turmeric.
Sprinkle each with salt and pepper; place chickens, side by side, atop fruit mixture.
Pour 11/2 cups water around chickens.
Roast chickens 1 hour.
Turn pan around; add more water to fruit mixture by 1/4 cupfuls if beginning to dry.
Continue to roast chickens until brown and juices run clear when thigh is pierced, about 45 minutes.
Transfer chickens to carving board; let stand 10 minutes.
Spoon fruit onto platter; top with chickens and any accumulated juices.
Sprinkle with almonds and serve.
97bb525c81.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the 7 tablespoons of olive oil, sugar, cinnamon, and turmeric.
3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, then place the chicken in a large roasting pan.
4. Pour the olive oil mixture over the chicken, ensuring that it is evenly coated.
5. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
6. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for about 15 minutes before carving and serving.
7. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the dried fruit and almond mixture. In a small bowl, mix the dried apricot halves, pitted dates, and toasted almonds.
8. After the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest.
9. In a small saucepan, heat the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the dried fruit and almond mixture and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
10. Serve the roast chicken with the dried fruit and almond mixture on the side.

[/INST]

a5230cef43.gt:
With and Electric mixer, beat butter & Icing sugar until it stands up like egg whites.
In a seperate medium bowl, combine flour and corn starch.
Add slowly to butter and icing sugar mixture.
(I find when your mixer starts to power out, then use a wooden spoon to take over, but please try to use the mixer as long as possible).
Drop from teaspoon onto cookie sheet about 2 inches apart.
Top cookies with jub-jubs, bar cherries, or anything really.
My oldest son loves smarties on his.
Imagination is up to you.
Bake at 300 for approx 30 minutes until bottom edges turn a light brown.
(Because all ovens vary please start checking them at about 20-25 minutes).
a5230cef43.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, icing sugar, and flour. Mix until the dough comes together.
3. Add the cornstarch and mix until the dough is smooth and no longer sticky.
4. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
5. Cut the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a sharp knife.
6. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
8. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

These steps will help someone create delicious whipped shortbread cookies using the ingredients and techniques displayed in the photo.

1a8f7f2d8d.gt:
In a medium-large bowl, combine the rhubarb, strawberries, sugar and cornstarch.
Mix well.
The mixture should be thick and syrupy after being stirred well.
Roll out pie crust according to recipe or package instructions and place in a 9- or 9.5-inch pie plate.
Pour the strawberry/rhubarb mixture into the crust, using a large spoon to fill evenly.
For the topping: In a small bowl, combine the flour and brown sugar.
Cut the butter into pieces and using a pastry cutter or two knives, cut the butter into the flour/sugar mixture until it has the consistency of coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle the streusel topping evenly over the top of the pie.
Place the pie on a rimmed baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 50-55 minutes, covering the pie crust edges with foil halfway through in order to prevent over-browning.
Let the pie cool completely before cutting into pieces.
Serve with a dollop of freshly whipped cream, if desired.
1a8f7f2d8d.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the sliced strawberries, rhubarb, and sugar until the fruit is coated evenly.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the cornstarch, flour, and brown sugar. Add the butter and mix until the mixture resembles crumbs.
4. Pour the fruit mixture into a pie crust, making sure to evenly distribute the fruit.
5. Sprinkle the crumb mixture evenly over the fruit.
6. Bake the pie for 45-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
7. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Strawberry Rhubarb Pie with Streusel Topping!

d4da80f96c.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine 3/4 cup sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, cinnamon, cloves and salt.
Stir in milk, melted butter and vanilla, beating until smooth.
Pour batter into an ungreased 9-inch squre baking pan.
Stir together remaining 1/2 cup sugar, brown sugar, remaining 1/4 cup cocoa and cinnamon.
Sprinkle this evenly over batter in baking dish.
Combine hot water and rum; pour this over top of sugar-cocoa mixture in dish; do not stir.
Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 350 degrees F until center is almost set.
Remove from oven and let stand 15 minutes.
Serve, spooning sauce from bottom of pan over top.
Delicious with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream!
d4da80f96c.pred:
To cook the Cinn-ful Fudgy Rum Pudding Cake, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, cinnamon, ground cloves, and salt.
3. Add the milk, melted butter, vanilla extract, and hot water to the dry ingredients, stirring until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
5. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once the cake is cooled, pour the rum over the top of the cake.
8. Allow the rum to soak into the cake for a few hours or overnight.
9. Serve the Cinn-ful Fudgy Rum Pudding Cake warm or at room temperature.

Enjoy your delicious Cinn-ful Fudgy Rum Pudding Cake!

f87ab5a162.gt:
In a large pot, heat the oil.
Add the onion and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until golden brown, 7 minutes.
Add the bacon and cook, stirring, until the fat has rendered, 10 minutes.
Add the collards and cook over moderately high heat, stirring, until it begins to wilt, 4 minutes.
Add the vinegar and boil for 1 minute.
Add the sorghum syrup, stock, water, crushed red pepper and a large pinch of salt.
Cover and cook, stirring a few times, until the collards are very tender, 1 1/2 hours.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, simmer the cream over moderate heat until reduced by one-third, 10 minutes.
Add the kimchi and remove from the heat.
When the collards are done, stir in the kimchi cream.
Season with salt and serve.
f87ab5a162.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the bacon and cook until it is crispy, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the collard greens, sherry vinegar, sorghum syrup (or maple syrup), chicken stock, water, crushed red pepper, salt, and heavy cream to the skillet. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the collard greens are tender and the sauce has thickened.
5. Stir in the kimchi and cook for an additional 5 minutes.

Enjoy your delicious Kimchi-Creamed Collard Greens!

bf5b8fd371.gt:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add in the tomatoes, capers, anchovies, olives and garlic.
Cook until fragrant and tomatoes soften.
This will take about 5 minutes.
Add in the tomato puree and season with salt and pepper.
Cook for a couple more minutes.
In the meantime in a large pot cook the spaghetti in salted water.
Cook until pasta is al dente (according to package instructions for al dente).
Reserve a cup or so of pasta water.
Drain the pasta and add it right the the sauce.
Add some of the reserved pasta water to thin out the sauce as needed.
Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve right away.
You can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese on top to serve.
bf5b8fd371.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook according to the package instructions until al dente.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes, capers, and anchovies to the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the tomato puree, salt, pepper, and Parmesan cheese to the skillet. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Drain the cooked spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the sauce. Toss to combine.
7. Transfer the spaghetti to a large oven-safe dish.
8. Bake the spaghetti in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the sauce is bubbly.
9. Serve the spaghetti immediately. Enjoy!

[/INST]

399c8a1881.gt:
Preheat oven to 200 deg Celsius.
Less for fan-forced.
Line 2 trays with non-stick paper.
In a small bowl cream together butter, sugar and vanilla.
Add egg yolk & beat well.
Sift together flour, soda, salt and nutmeg.
Fold half the sour cream and half the dry ingredients into the butter mixture.
Fold in remaining halves.
Mix well to combine.
With floured hands roll teaspoonfuls of mixture into small balls and place on prepared trays.
Press lightly on top with a fork.
Bake in oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until pale golden in colour.
Cool slightly on trays before moving to wire racks to cool.
Dip tops of biscuits in the Citrus Glaze.
Citrus Glaze: Combine icing sugar, juices and orange rind in a cup.
Place cup in saucepan of hot water, beat with fork until glossy.
Pour into a saucer to make icing the biscuits easier.
399c8a1881.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 175°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg yolk, vanilla extract, and bicarbonate of soda, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the flour, mixing until a soft dough forms.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the sour cream, icing sugar, lemon juice, and orange juice.
6. Gradually add the sour cream mixture to the flour mixture, mixing until the dough comes together.
7. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
8. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness.
9. Cut out the cookies using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
10. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
11. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
12. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

2b3918d7ce.gt:
Core the peppers using the blunt edge of a potato peeler, save half the seeds removed, toss the core.
In a bowl add cream cheese, chili powder, hot sauce (you pick the heat) and liquid smoke and half the jalapeno seeds.
Mix/Mash together until blended.
Stuff the cored peppers with cream cheese mix then wrap with raw bacon.
Use your fingers!
Kabob them, repeat untill all the peppers are stuffed and wrapped.
Grill on an indirect heat, (on tin foil) for about 15 minutes.
Then on an open flame for 5-8 mins to crisp the bacon, turning a few times.
Serve and enjoy!
2b3918d7ce.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the jalapeno pepper in half lengthwise, remove the seeds and membranes, and then slice it into 1/4-inch thick pieces.
3. In a large bowl, mix the cream cheese, chili powder, and hot sauce until well combined.
4. Add the sliced jalapeno pepper to the cream cheese mixture and stir to combine.
5. Wrap each piece of bacon around a jalapeno pepper slice, securing it with a toothpick.
6. Place the bacon-wrapped jalapeno peppers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Bake the jalapeno poppers in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the peppers are cooked through.
8. Remove the jalapeno poppers from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. Use a spoon to scoop the cream cheese filling onto the jalapeno poppers.
10. Sprinkle the liquid smoke over the jalapeno poppers before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Bacon Wrapped Jalapeno Poppers!

f62b39d078.gt:
Preheat oven to 375*.
Lightly spray bottom of 8- or 9-inch square pan with cooking spray.
Place apples in bottom of pan.
Mix remaining ingredients until crumbly; sprinkle over apples.
Bake for 30-45 minutes.
f62b39d078.pred:
To prepare the apple crisp, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the peeled and sliced apples, flour, oats, cinnamon, brown sugar, and nutmeg.
3. Add the softened butter to the mixture and stir until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Spread the mixture evenly into a baking dish or a pie pan.
5. Bake the apple crisp in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes, or until the crisp is golden brown and the apples are tender.
6. Allow the apple crisp to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your homemade apple crisp!

6a28e55b7e.gt:
First, grab that can of pumpkin.
I like to use Libbys, but you can use any brand you like.
Puree the pumpkin in your food processor, just to make sure that you take care of any big lumps.
We want the bisque to be nice and smooth.
Mix all the ingredients together in a sauce pan except for the evaporated milk.

c4c9825372.gt:

Oil up the pan.
Chop up some lemons and onions put them in the pan.
You can add foil paper to the pan if you dont want it to stick.
If your shrimp doesnt come deveind do that and add that to the pan.

d44553522d.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook bacon in large skillet until crispy, about 5 min.
; drain.

or until ground beef is browned, stirring constantly.

Top each serving with sour cream.

e03a1d1119.gt:

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Saute squash in butter until tender, about 10 minutes.
Set aside.
In a large skillet, cook the ground beef, onion, and jalapeno, stirring until beef is evenly browned.

d7f3a33c04.gt:
Heat olive oil in a cast iron pot.
Add onion and saute for 34 minutes until tender.
Add garlic and saute for an additional minute.
Take the onion and garlic out of the pot and set aside.
Add sausage to pan and brown.
(You do not have to add more oil.
The sausage tends to render a lot of grease when it is cooked.)
Drain excess grease and add the onion and garlic back to the pot.
Add broth, tomatoes and bay leaf.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Add gnocchi and cook until it floats to the top, 23 minutes.
Stir in spinach and kale and cook for an additional 12 minutes, until the greens are wilted.
Season soup to taste with salt, pepper, crushed red pepper flakes and Italian seasoning.
Serve immediately.
d7f3a33c04.pred:

1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.

5410800131.gt:
Fit a large steamer rack inside a large wide pot.
Add enough water to reach within 1/2 inch of bottom of rack.
Bring to a boil.
Pat chicken dry and put, skin side up, in a shallow bowl (that will fit on steamer rack inside pot).
Sprinkle with ginger and steam, covered, over high heat, until chicken is just cooked through, 30 to 35 minutes (replenish water if necessary).
Carefully remove bowl with chicken.
Pour off juices into a glass measure and set aside 1/4 cup (reserve remainder for another use).
Return chicken in bowl to pot and keep warm, covered, off heat.
Heat a wok or large heavy skillet (not nonstick) over high heat until smoking, then drizzle oil down side of wok and swirl to coat.
Reduce heat to medium, then add garlic and stir-fry 15 seconds.
Add chiles and stir-fry 15 seconds.
Add cilantro and stir-fry 1 minute.
Stir in remaining ingredients, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 cup chicken juices and simmer 1 minute.
Transfer to a bowl.
Drizzle some sauce over chicken (include some solids for a spicier sauce); serve the rest on the side.
Season chicken with salt.
5410800131.pred:

2. In a small bowl, mix the peanut or vegetable oil, minced garlic, and thin matchsticks of peeled ginger.
3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, then transfer it to a large, oven-safe baking dish.
4. Pour the oil mixture over the chicken, ensuring it is evenly coated.
5. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until it is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
6. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
7. In a small bowl, mix the coarsely chopped cilantro, water, soy sauce, and rice vinegar.
8. Serve the sliced chicken with the Xiao Fan's Special Sauce on the side.

Enjoy your delicious and flavorful dish!

0d43f262d2.gt:
Heat oil in a large pot.
Saute the onion until it starts to brown a little.
Add the chicken and cook each piece so it's browned on both sides.
Add potatoes and carrots.
Cook for a few minutes while stirring.
Add the tomatoes and cook for another few minutes while stirring.
Cover the pot and continue to cook on medium for 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add in the garlic and all the spices.
Mix well with other ingredients.
Add the zucchini, tomato paste, and a little salt and mix in.
Pour in enough water to just cover everything.
Bring to a boil, turn to low and let simmer for 45-50 minutes until every thing is well cooked and the stew has thickened.
Just before serving, stir in the chopped coriander.
Enjoy with basmati rice or bread :)

1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat.
2. Add the onion and cook until it is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute.
4. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.

8. Add the chicken back to the pot and bring the mixture to a simmer.
9. Reduce the heat to low and let the stew simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
10. Season the stew with salt to taste.
11. Serve the spiced chicken and vegetable stew over rice or with your favorite side dish.

[/INST]

d7fcbdcf2c.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Cream Crisco with both types of sugar.
To this mixture, add eggs (unbeaten), water, vanilla, flour, salt and soda.
Combine.
In another bowl, mix together oatmeal, nuts and chocolate chips.
Add to original mixture.
This dough will be very full, I prefer to mix it at this point with my hands.
Put teaspoonfuls of dough on a cookie sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
My children called their great grandmother (my grandmother) GeeGee.
She died last summer from cancer, so these cookies are very sentimental to us.
They are, the best chocolate chip cookies ever.
Hands down.
Thanks GeeGee!
We love you and miss you!
d7fcbdcf2c.pred:

2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the Crisco, sugar, and eggs until light and fluffy.
3. Add the water, vanilla, and flour, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the baking soda and salt, mixing until just combined.
5. Fold in the oatmeal, nuts, and chocolate chips.
6. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
8. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

These steps should help you make delicious GeeGees Chocolate Chip Cookies using the ingredients provided in the photo.

acc83d0fdd.gt:
In a medium saucepan, combine half of the strawberries with the sugar and 1/3 cup of water and bring to a simmer.
Cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is dissolved and the liquid is slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
Transfer the strawberry mixture to a food processor.
Add the remaining strawberries and puree until smooth.
Strain the puree through a fine sieve set over a large bowl.
Add the Champagne and lemon juice and mix well.
Pour the mixture into a 9-by-13-inch glass or stainless steel baking dish.
Freeze the granita for 2 hours.
Scrape the frozen edges into the center.
Freeze for another 3 hours, scraping hourly, until the granita is icy and flaky.
Freeze for 8 hours or overnight.
Scrape the granita into bowls and serve.
acc83d0fdd.pred:

2. In a large saucepan, combine the strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice.
3. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for about 30 minutes.
5. Pour the mixture into a shallow, 9-inch square baking dish.
6. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate it for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. After the granita has chilled, remove it from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes.
8. Using a fork, scrape the granita into a large bowl, breaking it up into smaller pieces as needed.
9. Serve the granita immediately or store it in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours.

[/SYS]

Mix coffee and syrups together in a mug.

419586e535.gt:

Pat into a 11x7x1 1/2 baking dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Cool.

Add to chocolate mixture alternately with milk and vanilla.

Cut into 16 bars.

03e7833d34.gt:

or until vegetables are crisp-tender.

Pat potatoes dry with paper towels.
Toss potatoes and mushrooms with 21/2 tbs oil, 2 tbs cheese, 2 tsp garlic and 2 tsp rosemary, 1/2 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper.

heat.

Cook 5-6 minutes on each side or until browned.

56bc2da383.gt:
Finely slice the leek, and mix with the ingredients.
Heat the sesame oil in a frying pan, and stir-fry the leek over high heat until it's wilted.
Add the combined flavoring ingredients and stir fry over low heat, being careful not to let it burn.
Add the bonito flakes, grated garlic and mix together.
Turn off the heat and add the ra-yu chili oil, and it's done!
(You may want to grind up the bonito flakes into a powder with your fingers while it's still in the packet.)
It goes so well with piping hot freshly cooked rice.
I can't stop eating!
It goes well with simmered daikon radish or pan-fried and steam-cooked daikon radish "steak" too.
It also goes well with pan fried tofu, boiled tofu, cold tofu, atsuage, dengaku (konnyaku with miso), and so many things.
It's also great as a dip for raw vegetables, and matches well with warm cooked vegetables too.
Please try this out in whatever combinations you can come up with.
Roll into tiny balls and freeze, to use as a filling for rice balls right away!
A Cookpad user called Yoshi-chan gave me this great idea!
If you don't have the green parts of the leeks, it's also delicious made with the white parts.
You may want to chop up and freeze the green parts and make this miso when you have enough.
