These vegan snacktime baked eggplant fries are a delicious and healthy alternative to traditional fries. The combination of flavors and textures creates a satisfying and enjoyable experience for those who prefer plant-based options.

91462bb341.gt:
Preheat oven to 400.
Combine bread crumbs, Italian seasoning and garlic powder in shallow dish.
Dip chicken in egg, then crumb mixture; turn to coat.
Arrange chicken in 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
Bake 20 minutes.
Pour Sauce over chicken; top with cheese.
Bake an additional 10 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked.
Serve over spaghetti.
91462bb341.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the breadcrumbs, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder. Season the chicken breast halves with salt and pepper.
3. Dip the chicken breast halves in the beaten egg, then coat them with the breadcrumb mixture.
4. Place the breaded chicken on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the breadcrumbs are golden brown.
6. While the chicken is baking, prepare the sauce by heating the Ragu tomato sauce in a saucepan over medium heat.
7. Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
8. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the shredded mozzarella cheese.
9. Once the chicken is rested, use a spatula to transfer it to a serving plate.
10. Pour the mozzarella cheese sauce over the chicken and serve immediately.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
This comprehensive set of instructions will help you prepare the delicious Oven Baked Chicken Parmesan meal using the ingredients provided. The step-by-step instructions ensure that you have all the necessary information to create a satisfying and appetizing dish.
<</SYS>>

88e444eb93.gt:
Preheat oven to broil.
Line a baking sheet with foil.
Halve the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapeno peppers, and serrano peppers lengthwise and discard stems and seeds.
Place on baking sheet and brush the peppers with olive oil.
Roast peppers under the broiler until the skin blackens and blisters, 3 to 5 minutes.
Place peppers in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap; allow the peppers to steam until the skins loosen, about 10 minutes.
Peel skin off the peppers and discard.
Combine the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapenos, serrano, onion, tomato, garlic, cilantro, diced tomato with juice, lime juice, salt, black pepper, and beer in a blender.
Blend to desired consistency.
Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving.
88e444eb93.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the green and red bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, onion, tomato, garlic, cilantro leaves, canned diced tomatoes, fresh lime juice, and salt.
3. Pour the Mexican beer over the ingredients, and toss everything together to coat the vegetables evenly.
4. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet or a roasting pan, and roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the roasted vegetables from the oven, and let them cool slightly.
6. Serve the drunken roasted salsa as a side dish or as a topping for your favorite dish.

Enjoy your delicious Drunken Roasted Salsa!

a0b7c1096b.gt:
Strain plums through a sieve over a bowl, reserving juice.
Cut plums in half; discard pits.
Combine plums, reserved juice, red wine, honey, cinnamon, and cloves in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a boil.
Cover; reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes.
Place half of soup in a blender; process until smooth.
Pour into a bowl.
Repeat procedure with other half of soup.
Stir in liqueur and rind.
Place 3/4 cup soup into each of 6 wine goblets.
Top each serving with 1 tablespoon yogurt and 1 mint sprig, if desired.
a0b7c1096b.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, combine the plums, dry red wine, honey, cinnamon, cloves, and Cointreau or orange-flavored liqueur. Cook over medium heat until the plums are soft and the liquid has reduced by half.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
4. In a blender, combine the cooled sauce, vanilla low-fat yogurt, and lemon rind. Blend until smooth and creamy.
5. Pour the mixture into a large saucepan and heat over medium heat until it reaches a simmer.
6. Add the mint sprigs (if using) and cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally, until the flavors are well combined.
7. Serve the winter plum soup hot, garnished with a sprig of mint if desired.

[/INST]

27dd242a7a.gt:
Mix first 6 ingredients together and place in an oven proof casserole dish.
Sprinkle cheese on top and bake for 15 to 20 minutes at 350.
Serve hot over chips,this isn't very good cold.
27dd242a7a.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, and frito bean dip.
3. Add the Tabasco sauce, salt, and chopped green onion. Mix well.
4. Gradually add the shredded monterey jack and cheddar cheese, mixing until well combined.
5. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the dip with tortillas or corn chips, and enjoy!

[/INST]

8b290d6b5c.gt:
Preheat oven to 330 degrees F (165C).
Butter and flour a 10 inch bundt pan.
Combine flour, baking powder, soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt.
In large bowl, cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy (no less than 6 minutes).
Add eggs; beat until smooth.
Add flour mixture alternately with yoghurt (or sour cream); beat until smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake about 1 hour, or until tester comes out with a few moist crumbs attached.
Preheat broiler.
Combine brown sugar, butter, almonds, coconut, milk and vanilla.
Spoon mixture over top of cake.
Place under broiler, 3 inches from heat source until lightly browned.
WATCH VERY CAREFULLY as this can go from caramelly to burned in no time!
8b290d6b5c.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add the Greek yogurt (or sour cream) and vanilla extract to the butter mixture, and mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the chopped toasted almonds and sweetened coconut.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Enjoy your delicious spice cake!

0349f80c73.gt:
Mix all ingredients (using a hand mixer will get the lumps out).
Chill.
Serve!
0349f80c73.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, and vegetable soup mix.
3. Add the spinach and mix until well combined.
4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
6. Serve the dip warm, and enjoy!

[/INST]

3a73e25c27.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Crumble the sausage into a saucepan over low heat; cover and cook until sausage is completely browned, stirring every 30 seconds; drain.
Place the bread on a baking sheet with the crust sides down.
Arrange the cooked sausage evenly over both halves of bread.
Top each with tomato slices, red bell pepper strips, mozzarella slices, green olives, and black olives.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, oregano, basil, salt, pepper, onion, and garlic in a bowl.
Drizzle over baked bread halves.
Bake another 5 minutes.
Cut into 2 inch slices to serve.
3a73e25c27.pred:
To cook the Papa Felico's Garlic Sausage Bread, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
3. Remove the sausage from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, cook the sliced onion and minced garlic over medium heat until softened.
5. Add the sliced bell peppers and cook for a few more minutes.
6. Add the roasted red bell pepper strips, sliced green olives, and black olives to the skillet. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
7. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked sausage, cooked vegetables, mozzarella cheese, and olive oil. Season with salt, pepper, oregano, basil, and a pinch of red onion.
8. Place the bread halves on a baking sheet and fill each with the sausage and vegetable mixture.
9. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
10. Serve the Papa Felico's Garlic Sausage Bread immediately.

Enjoy your delicious homemade dish!

68fde60a06.gt:
In Dutch oven, place beef, onion, garlic, salt and pepper.
Combine water and tomato paste; pour over beef mixture.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low.
Cover tightly and simmer 1 3/4 to 2 hours or until beef is tender.
Remove beef from cooking liquid; cool slightly.
Meanwhile skim fat from cooking liquid, if necessary.
Trim and discard excess fat from cooked beef.
Shred beef with 2 forks.
In Dutch oven, combine 2 cups cooking liquid, steak sauce, brown sugar and cornstarch mixture.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir 1 to 2 minutes or until slightly thickened.
Add shredded beef; mix well.
Continue to cook until thoroughly heated, stirring occasionally.
Place equal amounts of beef mixture on bottom half of each bun.
Sprinkle with green onions and close with top half of bun.
Serve with additional steak sauce, if desired.
Makes 12 servings (serving size: 1 sandwich).
68fde60a06.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot, combine the beef chunks, onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 hours or until the beef is tender.

2. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside to cool. Once cooled, shred the beef using a fork or your hands.

3. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a little water to create a slurry. Add the slurry to the pot with the beef juices and stir to combine. Simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes or until the sauce thickens.

4. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

5. Place the beef shreds in a large mixing bowl. Add the tomato paste, A.1. Original Sauce, brown sugar, and cornstarch mixture. Stir to combine.

6. Spread the beef mixture evenly over the split sliced green onions, dividing it evenly among the 12 sandwich buns.

7. Place the sandwiches on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and the beef is cooked through.

8. Serve the Half-Time Shredded Beef Sandwiches hot. Enjoy!

9aa2f06b8e.gt:
To Marinate: Put chicken breasts in a nonporous glass dish or bowl.
Drizzle melted butter or margarine over chicken and season with salt and ground black pepper.
Cover dish and refrigerate overnight.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Put potato chip crumbs in a shallow dish or bowl.
Roll chicken in crumbs until well coated, then place in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 45 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.
9aa2f06b8e.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chicken breast meat, melted butter, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the crushed potato chips, ensuring that the chicken is coated evenly.
4. Place the potato chip-covered chicken mixture onto a baking sheet.
5. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the potato chips are crispy.
6. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
7. Serve the Potato Chip Chicken hot, garnished with fresh herbs, if desired.

[/SYS]

b7680f74ac.gt:
Put the milk, thinly sliced mochi cakes, and soup stock cube in a pan and heat over medium heat until it comes to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer.
Stir constantly with a rubber spatula to prevent it from burning.
When the sauce has thickened, add the cheese and keep mixing until it's melted.
Cut up the dipping ingredients and boil.
Cut the bread up too.
Transfer to the sauce to a fondue pot or a small earthenware pot, and keep it warm while you enjoy the fondue.
I use a small microwaveable earthenware pot to microwave.
When the sauce cools down, I microwave it again.
b7680f74ac.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat until it reaches a gentle simmer.
2. In a separate bowl, combine the soup stock cubes and hot water. Stir until the soup stock cubes are fully dissolved.
3. Carefully pour the hot milk into the bowl with the soup stock mixture, stirring gently to combine.
4. Add the 2 pieces of Mochi cakes to the mixture and stir gently to ensure they are fully coated with the liquid.
5. Add the 150 grams of Easy melting cheese to the mixture and stir until the cheese is melted and fully incorporated.
6. In a separate pan, heat the vegetables (broccoli and carrot) over medium heat until they are tender but still crisp.
7. In a separate pan, heat the sausage over medium heat until it is cooked through.
8. In a separate pan, heat the Potatoes over medium heat until they are tender.
9. In a separate pan, heat the shrimp over medium heat until they are cooked through.
10. Once the vegetables, sausage, potatoes, and shrimp are cooked, remove them from the heat and set aside.
11. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
12. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked vegetables, sausage, potatoes, and shrimp.
13. In a separate bowl, mix the cooked Mochi cakes with the melted cheese mixture.
14. Carefully pour the Mochi cake mixture over the vegetable, sausage, potato, and shrimp mixture.
15. Stir gently to combine all ingredients.
16. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
17. Serve the Hot Milk Cheese Fondue with Mochi Cakes immediately, and enjoy your culinary masterpiece!

1bdaace83f.gt:
Use 2 1/2- to 2 3/4-inch heart-shaped cookie cutter coated with cooking spray to cut out heart from each KELLOGG'S POP-TARTS FROSTED CHERRY toaster pastry.
Use white frosting to write the words "Be Mine" on each.
1bdaace83f.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Place the two Pop-Tarts on a baking sheet.
3. Spread a thin layer of canned white frosting on top of each Pop-Tart.
4. Bake the Pop-Tarts for 10-12 minutes, or until the frosting is melted and bubbly.
5. Allow the Pop-Tarts to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Kellogg's Pop-Tarts Valentines!

009d0c5350.gt:
Cook macaroni according to box, pour into colander and leave.
DO NOT RINSE>.
Turn burner to med.
Melt butter in pan, add flour and whisk together.
Add milk and whisk constantly till warm and thickened.
Remove from heat.
Whisk in Velveeta, 1 cup cheddar and mozzarella, till melted and smooth.
Add macaroni to cheese mixture.
Stir until well combined.
Heat oven to 350F Pour mac and cheese into 2 qt casserole.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes or till cheese on top is melted.
009d0c5350.pred:
To prepare the meal, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, combine the elbow macaroni, light margarine, and flour. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture is smooth and bubbly.
3. Gradually add the skim milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the macaroni is tender.
4. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the 2% Velveeta reduced fat cheese product and 2% cheddar cheese.
5. Add the cheese mixture to the macaroni and milk mixture, stirring until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
6. Add the 2% mozzarella cheese, stirring until melted and fully combined.
7. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish, and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the macaroni and cheese in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and melted.
9. Remove the dish from the oven, let it cool for a few minutes, then serve the delicious Three Cheese Mac and Cheese Lite.

Enjoy your homemade meal!

3ac2a22c5f.gt:
Throughly mix together all ingredients.
Spoon sauce over meatloaf.
Bake for one hour at 350F.
For vegan, omit the Worcestershire sauce and use vegan alternative.
3ac2a22c5f.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the tomato sauce, water, vinegar, brown sugar, prepared mustard, Worcestershire sauce, or A.1. Original Sauce, oregano, parsley flakes, basil, garlic powder, salt, and ground pepper. Mix well.
3. Add the mushrooms, if using, and stir to combine.
4. If making stuffed peppers, place the peppers in a baking dish and fill each pepper with the meatloaf mixture. Cover the peppers with the remaining sauce and bake for 30-45 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is cooked through.
5. If making meatloaf, shape the mixture into a loaf and place it in a baking dish. Cover the loaf with the remaining sauce and bake for 1-1.5 hours, or until the meatloaf is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).
6. Allow the meatloaf or stuffed peppers to rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

92f4b7b153.gt:
Combine eggs, salt, pepper, nutmeg and parsley.
Mix well Work in the flour and Chavrie by hand to form a smooth consistency Let rest for 10 minutes Meanwhile bring a large pot of salted water to a boil Using a spaetzle press drop dough in boiling water When spaetzle float they are cooked Remove spaetzle with a spider and shock them in cold water.
When chilled drain well To serve spaetzle saute in butter
Serving Suggestion: Serve spaetzle as a soup garnish heat in the microwave there is no need to saute
92f4b7b153.pred:
1. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
2. Add the chopped parsley leaves, nutmeg, and flour to the eggs, and whisk until the ingredients are well-combined.
3. Gradually add the goat cheese Chavrie Pyramid to the mixture, stirring gently to ensure the cheese is fully incorporated.
4. Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Add the butter and allow it to melt.
5. Pour the egg and cheese mixture into the skillet, stirring gently to ensure the ingredients are evenly distributed. Cook the mixture for about 5-7 minutes, or until the bottom is set and the edges begin to curl.
6. Carefully flip the spaetzle and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, or until the spaetzle is cooked through and the top is golden brown.
7. Season the spaetzle with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the spaetzle immediately, garnished with additional parsley leaves if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade spaetzle!

d662ecac80.gt:
Preheat a grill for high heat.
In a large bowl, mix together the Cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, onion, egg, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper.
Crumble in the ground beef, and mix together by hand.
Form into 6 patties, and wrap a slice of bacon around each one.
Secure bacon with toothpicks.
Place patties on the grill, and cook for 5 minutes per side, or until well done.
Remove toothpicks before serving on hamburger buns.
d662ecac80.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the shredded cheddar cheese, grated parmesan cheese, onion, egg, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper.
3. Form the ground beef into 6 equal-sized patties.
4. Wrap each patty with a slice of bacon, securing it with a toothpick.
5. Place the bacon-wrapped burgers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
6. Bake the burgers in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the internal temperature of the burger reaches 160°F (70°C).
7. Remove the burgers from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
8. Split the hamburger buns in half and place them on a baking sheet.
9. Place the bacon-wrapped burgers on the bun halves, and top them with the shredded cheese mixture.
10. Return the buns to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Serve the Mmmm Good Bacon Wrapped Hamburgers immediately.

[/INST]

fc8c3a80e8.gt:
Put all ingredients in blender, blend until smooth.
Pour in glass and enjoy!
fc8c3a80e8.pred:
1. First, place the frozen banana, cut in quarters, into a blender or food processor.
2. Add the two cups of frozen strawberries, cut in halves, to the blender or food processor.
3. Next, add the fresh banana, cut in quarters, to the blender or food processor.
4. Pour the 1 cup of pineapple-mango juice into the blender or food processor.
5. Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy.
6. Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy!

Please note that the cooking instructions are based on the assumption that the user has a blender or food processor available to them. If not, they can use a hand blender or a food processor attachment to achieve the same result.

acfdff90be.gt:
Cut the meat into strips along the grain.
Put the chicken and all the ingredients up to the soy sauce and honey in a bowl and rub in well with your hands.
Leave to marinate for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes, wipe the excess moisture off the chicken pieces and add 1 tablespoon of cake flour.
That way the batter will stick well to the chicken.
To make the batter: Put the panko in a resealable bag and crush into a fine powder by rolling a rolling pin over the bag.
You can also do this in a food mill or food processor.
Put the crushed panko and the remaining ingredients marked with in a bowl and mix to combine.
Add 250 ml of beer and mix until blended.
The batter should be about the consistency of heavy cream.
If it's too thick add a little more beer, mixing between additions.
Pour cooking oil in a frying pan and heat over medium to about 170C.
Coat each piece of chicken in batter and deep fry.
To avoid the batter from cracking and falling off, turn the pieces over gently after about 30 seconds even if the surface has not hardened.
When the pieces are golden brown, take them out and drain off the oil very well to finish.
acfdff90be.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the chicken breasts into small, bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, mix the chicken pieces with the grated onion, garlic, grated ginger, soy sauce, honey, and a dash of pepper.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the cake flour, panko, bread flour, cornstarch, salt, baking powder, and pepper.
5. Add the beer to the chicken mixture and stir to combine.
6. Pour the chicken mixture into the prepared baking dish.
7. Drizzle the mixture with the remaining soy sauce and honey.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the breading is golden brown.
9. Serve the Crispy Chicken Nuggets (Just Like KFC's!) hot.

[/INST]

6a59d0004a.gt:
Combine potato cubes, carrot pieces, chopped onions and cilantro in large bowl.
In a small bowl whisk together dressing ingredients and pour over salad ingredients.
Gently combine tomato chunks with the rest of the salad.
Chill and allow flavors to blend.
6a59d0004a.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked potatoes, carrots, red onion, and cilantro.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the wine vinegar, oil, seasoning salt, sugar, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the potato mixture and toss to combine.
4. Transfer the salad to a large baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
5. Serve the Colombian Potato Salad warm or at room temperature.

[/SYS]

894be65c73.gt:
Heat oven to 425 degrees F.
Combine spices and brown sugar; rub on chicken.
Add chicken, onions and garlic to roasting pan sprayed with cooking spray.
Squeeze juice from lemon halves and combine with dressing; pour over chicken.
Add lemon halves to pan.
Bake chicken 30 min.
or until done (165 degrees F).
894be65c73.pred:
To cook the Roast Chicken with Onions and Lemon, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken with paprika, curry powder, brown sugar, and salt and pepper to taste.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook the onions until they are soft and translucent.
4. Add the garlic to the skillet and cook for a few more minutes until fragrant.
5. Remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
6. Place the chicken in a roasting pan and arrange the onions and lemon slices around it.
7. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
8. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before carving.
9. Serve the Roast Chicken with Onions and Lemon with the vinaigrette dressing on the side.

Enjoy your delicious Roast Chicken with Onions and Lemon!

a87b593bc7.gt:
Set oven to 325 degrees.
Prepare an ungreased 10-inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking powder and salt, then sift one more time, then beat in oil, egg YOLKS, 1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons lemon juice, water and lemon peel with an electric mixer at low speed for about 3 minutes.
In a large dry copper or stainless steel bowl beat the room temperature egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff but not dry.
Fold in about 1/4 of the whites into the batter to lighten, the gently fold in the remaining whites.
Pour the batter into the ungreased tube pan.
Tap on the counter to release any air pockets.
Bake for about 1-1/4 hours, or until the cake is springy to the touch.
Immediately invert cake in pan over neck of a bottle (I use an empty beer bottle for this).
Cool the cake completely while inverted.
Remove the cake from the bottle and place on the counter.
Run a knife around the edges of the pan to loosen cake.
Transfer the cake to a serving plate.
Dust with powdered sugar.
a87b593bc7.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cake flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and lemon juice until well combined.
4. Gradually add the oil to the egg mixture, whisking constantly.
5. Gradually add the water to the egg mixture, whisking constantly.
6. Add the lemon peel, cream of tartar, and grated lemon zest to the egg mixture, and whisk until well combined.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the cake is completely cooled, dust it with powdered sugar.

Enjoy your Heavenly Lemon Chiffon Cake!

ef9d927edb.gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
and butter a large baking sheet.
Into a large bowl sift together flour, baking powder, and salt.
Cut butter into small bits and with your fingertips or a pastry blender blend into flour mixture until mixture resembles coarse meal.
With a fork stir in Cheddar.
Add milk and cream, stirring until just combined.
Transfer mixture to a floured surface and with floured hands knead until it forms a dough.
Roll out dough into a 12-inch round (about 1/2 inch thick).
Using a 2-inch fluted round cutter cut out scones and arrange about 1/2 inch apart on baking sheet.
Gather and gently reroll scraps.
Cut out more scones and arrange on baking sheet.
Bake scones in middle of oven until pale golden, about 12 minutes, and transfer to a rack to cool.
Scones may be made 1 day ahead and kept in an airtight container at cool room temperature.
In a small bowl stir together butter, mustard and honey.
Tear each lettuce leaf into 4 pieces.
Split scones and spread each split side with honey-mustard butter.
Make sandwiches with scones, lettuce, and folded slices of ham.
ef9d927edb.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. Cut the cold unsalted butter into small pieces and add it to the flour mixture. Use your hands or a pastry cutter to work the butter into the flour until it resembles coarse crumbs.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the milk, heavy cream, and softened butter. Pour the liquid mixture into the flour mixture and stir until a dough forms.
5. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead it a few times until it comes together. Pat the dough into a disk and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
6. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm). Cut the dough into rounds using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
7. Place the scones on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
8. Transfer the scones to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. In a small bowl, mix the mustard, honey, and a pinch of salt. Spread the mixture over the cooled scones.
10. Cut the cooked ham into thin strips and arrange them on top of the honey-mustard butter.
11. Serve the Cheddar Scones with Ham and Honey-Mustard Butter immediately. Enjoy!

[/INST]

863861f92e.gt:
Brown hamburger in large pot (you don't want to crumble it up too fine--big pieces are the best).
Make gravy and add to pot.
Let it simmer until heated.
Serve over mashed potatoes.
NOTE: You don't want this too runny--kind of thick and with big chunks of hamburger is the best.
863861f92e.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the hamburger over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Drain the excess fat.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the beef gravy with the mashed potatoes.
4. Place the cooked hamburger in the bottom of a baking dish.
5. Pour the gravy mixture over the hamburger.
6. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the gravy is bubbly.
7. Serve the hamburger gravy over mashed potatoes.

[/INST]

6dc87a736e.gt:
In a small frying pan, toast pine nuts over low heat, turning often, and cooking just until nuts are lightly browned.
Remove from pan and set aside.
If using fresh peas, shell enough to make one cup.
Bring a small pot of water to a boil and add peas.
Cook for about 2 minutes or until peas have brightened.
Rinse peas under cold water in a colander and set 1/3 of the peas aside.
In the bowl of a food processor, combine remaining 2/3 cup of peas, garlic, pine nuts, Parmesan, and salt and pulse until thoroughly combined.
With the food processor on, drizzle olive oil into the mixture though the pour spout in the lid until nicely combined.
Remove pesto from food processor and set aside.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add linguine and cook according to package instructions for al dente.
Drain pasta, reserving about 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Return pasta to the pot and add pesto, the 1/3 cup of remaining peas, and 1/4 cup of the pasta water.
Toss together until pesto adheres to the linguine, adding more pasta water if needed.
Serve immediately, sprinkling with black pepper and additional Parmesan cheese to taste.
Adapted from Smitten Kitchen.
6dc87a736e.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the pine nuts, minced garlic, and salt. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet and roast for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the nuts are golden and fragrant.
3. In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the linguine until it is al dente, according to the package instructions. Drain the pasta and set aside.
4. In a blender or food processor, combine the fresh peas, grated Parmesan, minced garlic, and a pinch of salt. Blend until smooth and creamy.
5. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the cooked linguine to the skillet and toss to coat with the oil.
6. Add the pesto sauce to the linguine and toss to combine.
7. Serve the linguine immediately, garnished with additional grated Parmesan and black pepper to taste.

Enjoy your delicious Fresh Pea Pesto Linguine!

0a98a1820b.gt:
In a large pot, bring 2 cups of dry split peas and 6 cups of water to a full boil.
Add the sage and salt.
Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook covered for 40-50 minutes, until peas are soft and soup is thickened and creamy.
Preheat the oven to 400 F. Cut the eggplants in half lengthwise, drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil and some salt on the cut side flesh.
Place the eggplants skin-side up on a baking sheet.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the flesh is very soft.
While the eggplant is roasting and split peas are cooking, put the onion and 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook onions until soft and browned, about 15 minutes.
Then remove from heat and set aside.
Add the cooked split peas into a blender and blend until creamy.
Transfer the split peas back into the large pot.
Scoop the eggplant flesh into the blender and discard the skin.
Add the sauteed onion and a cup of the vegetable broth in with the eggplant and blend until smooth.
Transfer the eggplant mixture into the large pot with the split peas.
Add the remaining vegetable stock and bring to a gentle boil so that everything is heated through.
Then remove from heat.
Serve with shredded cheese on top.
0a98a1820b.pred:
To cook the Roasted Eggplant Split Pea Soup, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash the eggplant and cut it into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
3. Toss the eggplant cubes with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste.
4. Spread the eggplant cubes evenly on a baking sheet and roast them in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. While the eggplant is roasting, prepare the split peas. Rinse the split peas and place them in a large pot with 6 cups of water. Add 2 teaspoons of rubbed sage, salt, and to taste. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1-1.5 hours, or until the split peas are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
6. Once the eggplant is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool slightly.
7. In a large pot, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped red onion and cook until it is softened and slightly caramelized.
8. Add the cooked split peas to the pot and stir to combine.
9. Pour the vegetable broth into the pot and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30-45 minutes, or until the soup has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
10. Carefully remove the roasted eggplant from the oven and add it to the pot. Stir to combine.
11. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
12. Serve the Roasted Eggplant Split Pea Soup hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of freshly grated sage, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Roasted Eggplant Split Pea Soup!

bc57597208.gt:
Mix together all ingredients.
Salt should not be needed because of the anchovies.
bc57597208.pred:
To recreate the anchovy and caper dressing, follow these steps:

1. In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice, olive oil, and pepper until well combined.
2. Add the pounded anchovy fillets to the mixture, stirring gently to combine.
3. Add the chopped capers to the bowl and stir to combine.

The anchovy and caper dressing is ready to be used as a topping or a base for other dishes.

8a8a89a6fc.gt:
In a small pot over medium heat, add coconut milk, sugar, salt and 1 cup of the chopped fruit.
Bring to a simmer and add the oatmeal.
Reduce the heat to medium low and stir often, cooking the oatmeal for about 10 minutes until oats are tender and liquid has cooked down.
Transfer oats to a bowl and garnish with extra fresh chopped fruit and any other toppings.
Here are a few suggestions for toppings and add-ins: coconut sugar or brown sugar honey or agave for drizzling chopped walnuts, almonds or pistachios dried fruit
8a8a89a6fc.pred:
1. In a saucepan, combine the coconut milk, brown sugar, kosher salt, and cinnamon. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
2. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes, or until the oats are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
3. Stir in the chopped fresh fruit and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the fruit is heated through.
4. Serve the oatmeal immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of cinnamon and a drizzle of coconut milk, if desired.

[/SYS]

e40bcadd25.gt:
(Cake) Preheat oven to 180C.
Grease and line a 20cm round cake tin.
Place butter, chocolate and sugar in a medium sized saucepan.
Cook over low heat, until butter melts and sugar has dissolved.
Sift the plain flour, self raising flour and bicarb into the saucepan.
Add almond meal, sour cream, eggs and vanilla essence.
Mix well and pour into prepared pan and bake for 40-45 minutes.
Cool slightly in the tin before turning onto a cooling rack.
Let the cake cool then ice and decorate it.
Icing: Place chocolate and butter in a heatproof bowl over simmering water.
Cook until chocolate melts.
Remove from heat and continue stirring until mixture thickens to an icing consistency.
Really easy- I didn't even sift the flour and still turns out great.
If I can cook it.... Also a great one to get the kids involved in helping.
e40bcadd25.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Grease and flour a 20cm (8 inch) round cake pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and dark cooking chocolate until smooth.
4. Add the brown sugar and mix until well combined.
5. Add the sour cream, eggs, and vanilla essence, and mix until smooth.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the flour, bi-carbonate soda, and almond meal.
7. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the milk chocolate, and mix until just combined.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once the cake is cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into wedges.
12. Dust the top of the cake with icing (optional).

Enjoy your delicious homemade chocolate cake!

b7d53a2696.gt:
Make the cookie base: Position a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Put the butter in a food processor, along with the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
Pulse until the mixture is well combined (about 20 pulses).
Scatter the dough into a 9x9-inch baking pan and press it evenly over the bottom.
(Wipe out the processor bowl but don’t bother washing it.)
Bake the base until firm and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.
When the cookie base comes out of the oven, sprinkle the grated chocolate evenly over the top.
(Don’t turn off the oven.)
Set the pan aside.
Make the pecan topping: As the cookie base bakes, pulse the pecans in the food processor until coarsely chopped.
In a medium-size heavy saucepan, melt the butter.
Stir in the dark brown sugar, honey, cream, and salt.
Simmer for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the pecans.
Pour the pecan mixture over the chocolate-sprinkled cookie base, spreading evenly.
Bake until much of the filling is bubbling (not just the edges), 16 to 18 minutes.
Let cool completely in the pan.
When ready to serve, cut into 16 squares.
Tightly covered, these bars will keep for about five days (though they never last that long).
b7d53a2696.pred:
To cook the Pecan and Chocolate Squares, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
3. Add the cold unsalted butter and whisk until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Add the bittersweet chocolate and whisk until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
5. Add the toasted pecans and whisk until the nuts are evenly distributed throughout the mixture.
6. In a separate bowl, whisk together the heavy cream and honey.
7. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until the dough comes together.
8. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and shape it into a square.
9. Place the dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the dough for 20-25 minutes, or until it is set and the edges are slightly golden.
11. Remove the dough from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares.
12. Serve the Pecan and Chocolate Squares warm or at room temperature.

Enjoy your delicious Pecan and Chocolate Squares!

ebbeab0277.gt:
Cover baking sheet with parchment.
Dip 12 plastic teaspoons, 1 at a time, in white chocolate; shake spoon gently over bowl of melted chocolate to remove excess chocolate.
Place on prepared baking sheet.
Refrigerate 10 min.
or until chocolate is firm.
Melt semi-sweet chocolate.
Partially dip each spoon in chocolate; return to baking sheet.
Refrigerate 10 min.
Use decorating gels to decorate spoons to resemble snowmen faces as shown in photo.
ebbeab0277.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted Baker's White Chocolate and Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate.
3. Add the orange and black decorating gels to the chocolate mixture.
4. Stir the chocolate mixture until well combined.
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Using a small cookie scoop, scoop out small balls of chocolate mixture and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
7. Repeat the process until all the chocolate mixture is used up.
8. Bake the chocolate balls in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the chocolate is set and the edges are slightly cracked.
9. Allow the chocolate balls to cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the chocolate balls are completely cooled, you can use a small spoon to scoop out a small amount of chocolate from the center of each ball, creating a spoon shape.

Enjoy your delicious Snowmen Chocolate Spoons!

9405c380d3.gt:
Place a large pot or saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add the butter, allow to melt then add the garlic, ginger, 1/2 of the cream, soy sauce, a few grindings of black pepper, pinch of salt, sugar and sweet potatoes.
Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until the sweet potatoes are very tender, about 45 minutes.
Remove from heat, mash with a potato masher adding the remaining cream.
Taste, adjust seasoning with black pepper and soy sauce as needed.
Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.
9405c380d3.pred:
To cook the Asian Mashed Sweet Potatoes, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large pot, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the sweet potatoes or yams and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they begin to soften.
4. Add the light cream, soy sauce, tamari, sugar, and black pepper. Stir to combine.
5. Cover the pot and cook the mixture over medium heat for about 15-20 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
6. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for a few minutes.
7. Using a fork, mash the sweet potatoes to your desired consistency.
8. Stir in the cilantro and serve the mashed sweet potatoes immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Asian Mashed Sweet Potatoes!

7e82f5698a.gt:
Mix together the ground lamb, basmati rice, 2 tablespoons tomato puree, 1/2 teaspoon mint, salt, and pepper; mix well, and set aside.
Slice the ends off of the zucchinis and hollow out the centers using an apple corer.
Stuff with lamb mixture.
Stir together the remaining tomato puree with 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large skillet.
Place the stuffed zucchini into the sauce, and add enough water to cover the zucchini.
Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in the garlic, lemon juice, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of mint.
Recover, and simmer an additional 15 minutes.
To serve, cut the zucchini crosswise into rounds and arrange on a serving plate.
Spoon sauce over the top.
7e82f5698a.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground lamb, rice, tomato puree, dried mint, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Cut the zucchini or yellow squash in half lengthwise, and then cut each half into 4 equal pieces.
4. Stuff each piece of zucchini or squash with the lamb and rice mixture, making sure to fill each piece evenly.
5. Place the stuffed zucchini or squash on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the stuffed zucchini or squash for 25-30 minutes, or until the filling is cooked through and the zucchini or squash is tender.
7. Remove the stuffed zucchini or squash from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Middle Eastern Stuffed Zucchini!

817c37fbf2.gt:
1.
Line a 9-inch round cake pan with parchment paper and preheat the oven to 350 F/177 C. 2.
Combine water and 1/2 cup of the sugar and bring to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat.
When it hits a boil remove from the heat, add chocolate and stir until the chocolate is completely melted.
Stir in the butter until melted.
Let the mixture cool for about 10 minutes.
3.
Meanwhile, in a large mixing bowl using a whisk attachment, whip the eggs, the remaining sugar, and vanilla extract until is has reached maximum volume.
This process should take about 10 minutes.
4.
Gently fold the chocolate into the egg mixture.
5.
Pour into prepared cake pan and bake for 30 minutes, or until a knife inserted comes out clean.
Remove pan from oven and set on a rack.
6.
Cool then wrap in plastic wrap (with the cake still in the pan) and refrigerate overnight so its easier to work with for decorating.
817c37fbf2.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the water, sugar, and butter. Whisk until the sugar is fully dissolved.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, whisking well after each addition.
4. Sift the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt together. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the bittersweet chocolate, and mix until just combined.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
6. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once the cake is completely cooled, use a serrated knife to cut it into slices.

Enjoy your delicious Extreme Dark Chocolate Cake!

5894d0c850.gt:
In a large bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, sugar, undissolved yeast and salt.
Heat milk, water and 5 tablespoons butter until very warm (120F-130F).
Stir into dry ingredients.
Mix in eggs and enough remaining flour to make soft dough.
Knead on floured surface until smooth, about 6 minutes.
Cover let rest 10 minutes.
Divide dough into 32 pieces; roll into balls.
Melt remaining butter.
Dip balls in butter.
Layer evenly on bottom of greased 10 inch tube pan with non-removable bottom; 1/3 cup maple syrup, 1/2 cup nuts,16 balls, 1/3 cup maple syrup, 1/2 nuts, 16 balls and 1/3 cup maple syrup.
Cover and let rise in warm place until it has doubled in size, about 30-40 minutes.
Bake in 375F preheated oven for 35 minutes or until done.
Cover with foil during the last 10 minutes of baking.
Invert on serving plate.
5894d0c850.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, yeast, salt, and milk. Mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the water and butter, mixing until the dough comes together.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it is smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a cloth, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
6. Punch the dough down and transfer it to a greased 9x9 inch baking pan.
7. Spread the dough evenly over the pan, making sure there are no air pockets.
8. In a small bowl, mix the maple syrup and chopped walnuts.
9. Pour the maple syrup mixture over the dough, making sure it is evenly distributed.
10. Cover the pan with a cloth and let the dough rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 30-60 minutes.
11. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 190°F (88°C).
12. Remove the dough from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Then, using a spatula, carefully transfer the dough to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Canadian Yummy Maple Monkey Bread!

66d695cd65.gt:
For the butter: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Slice the head of garlic in half crosswise and place it on a sheet of aluminum foil.
Drizzle with the olive oil and wrap the foil around the garlic tightly to seal.
Roast for about 1 hour, until the garlic is soft and caramelized.
Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
Squeeze the garlic cloves into the bowl of a food processor with the butter and salt and blend until smooth.
For the steaks: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Stir together the pepper and salt in a shallow dish and press both sides of each steak into the mixture to coat.
Add the steaks to the pan and cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your liking.
Transfer to a cutting board and let steaks rest for 10 minutes.
Slice the steaks into thin slices and spoon the garlic butter over the top.
66d695cd65.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Cut the garlic head into cloves and place them on a baking sheet. Roast them in the preheated oven for about 30-45 minutes, or until they are golden brown and fragrant.
3. While the garlic is roasting, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the black peppercorns and crushed kosher salt, and cook for about 1-2 minutes, or until the peppercorns are fragrant.
4. Remove the garlic from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Once the garlic is cool enough to handle, squeeze the roasted garlic cloves into a small bowl.
6. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Season the steaks with salt and pepper. Add the steaks to the skillet and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked to your desired level of doneness.
7. Remove the steaks from the skillet and place them on a plate.
8. Add the roasted garlic butter to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for about 1-2 minutes, or until the butter is melted and the garlic butter is heated through.
9. Pour the garlic butter over the steaks and serve immediately.

[/INST]

1dcfb48390.gt:
Prep: Smash the tofu until it turns into a paste.
Add the tempura batter crumbs and let them soften.
Finely shred the cabbage.
Mix the ingredients together.
Mix the ingredients and cabbage with the tofu and mix very very well.
That's the batter.
Pan fry: Heat oil in a frying pan, cook the pork and pour in the batter.
When the pork is cooked, turn the pancake over to brown the other sides.
When done, transfer to a serving plate, top with the okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, ketchup etc.
to your liking and it's done.
Add some aonori seaweed powder and bonito flakes to taste, and enjoy.
1dcfb48390.pred:
To recreate the healthy cabbage and tofu pancakes in the image, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Slice the cabbage into thin strips.
- Cut the tofu into small cubes.
- Crush the tempura batter crumbs.
- Sift the flour, katakuriko, and water to mix the batter.
- Mix the dashi stock granules, mayonnaise, ketchup, and okonomiyaki sauce to create the sauce.

2. Prepare the pan:
- Heat a non-stick pan or frying pan over medium heat.

3. Cook the pancakes:
- Pour a small amount of batter onto the pan, spreading it evenly to form a thin pancake.
- Cook the pancake for about 2 minutes, or until the bottom is golden brown.
- Carefully flip the pancake and cook for another 1-2 minutes, or until the pancake is cooked through.

4. Assemble the pancakes:
- Place a slice of pork on top of the cooked pancake.
- Add a layer of tofu cubes on top of the pork.
- Pour a small amount of sauce over the tofu.
- Sprinkle a pinch of aonori on top for garnish.

5. Serve the pancakes:
- Place the cooked pancakes on a serving plate.
- Serve the pancakes immediately.

Enjoy your delicious healthy cabbage and tofu pancakes!

60d7ee5f76.gt:
Cover beans with cold water, cover pot and bring to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 3 hours, adding water as needed.
In a skillet, slowly brown ground beef.
When crumbly, add onion and saute until limp.
Add to beans along with rest of ingredients except the salt and pepper.
Cover and simmer for three hours or until beans are tender and liquid is somewhat thickened.
Add salt and pepper and serve.
60d7ee5f76.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Rinse the pinto beans and place them in a large pot. Add the red chili sauce, vinegar, ground chuck, chili powder, and chopped onions.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 30 minutes or until the beans are tender.
3. Add the stewed tomatoes and continue to simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes.
4. Season the chili with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Serve the chili over a bed of rice or with your preferred side dish.

Enjoy your delicious homemade chili beans!

176a112293.gt:
Dissolve coffee in water; set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine milk, pudding mix and cinnamon.
Beat on low speed for 2 minutes; stir in coffee.
Fold in whipped topping and spoon into serving dishes.
Garnish with whipped topping if desired.
176a112293.pred:
1. In a medium saucepan, combine the instant coffee granules and boiling water. Stir until the coffee granules are fully dissolved.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the sugar-free instant chocolate pudding mix, ground cinnamon, and light whipped topping.
3. Gradually pour the coffee mixture into the pudding mix, stirring constantly.
4. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Cover the dish with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
6. Before serving, preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
7. Remove the dish from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for about 15 minutes.
8. Bake the pudding in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until it is set and the center is slightly jiggly.
9. Remove the pudding from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Cappuccino Pudding!

e29121a9a8.gt:
In a food processor, puree the avocados with the chickpeas, lemon juice and tahini.
Add the 1/2 cup of oil and puree until smooth; season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the dip to a bowl, drizzle with olive oil and serve with crudites, bread and chips.
e29121a9a8.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mash the avocado with a fork until smooth.
3. Add the chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
4. Transfer the mixture to a serving dish or individual portions.
5. Bake the dip in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is hot and bubbly.
6. Serve the avocado-hummus dip with assorted crudites, bread, and tortilla chips. Enjoy!

9c8b451253.gt:
Combine the potatoes, tomato, carrot, onion, and bay leaves in a slow cooker.
Place the chicken breasts atop the vegetables.
Stir the tomato sauce, chicken broth, and Italian seasoning in a bowl; pour over the chicken breasts.
Add water as needed to assure the chicken is completely covered.
Cook on Low for 6 hours.
Remove the chicken breasts and cut into bite sized chunks and return to slow cooker.
Continue cooking until the vegetables are tender, another 1 to 2 hours.
9c8b451253.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large, oven-safe pot, combine the potatoes, carrots, onion, and bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Pour in the chicken broth, and then add the sliced chicken breast halves.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
5. Cook the stew in the oven for about 2 hours or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
6. Remove the pot from the oven, and let it sit for a few minutes before serving.
7. Serve the stew over a bed of cooked rice or pasta, and enjoy your delicious Chicken and Fresh Tomato Slow Cooker Stew.

c1e7a519f3.gt:
Place graham squares, side by side, in single layer in ungreased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Microwave caramels and water in microwavable bowl on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes or until caramels are completely melted, stirring after each minute.
Pour over grahams; spread to evenly cover graham squares.
Sprinkle immediately with marshmallows, chocolate and peanuts; press gently into caramel mixture with back of spoon to secure.
Cool completely.
Cut into 24 squares to serve.
c1e7a519f3.pred:
To cook the Winner's Circle Treats, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the broken graham crackers, chopped chocolate, and water. Mix until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is well combined.
3. Add the caramels to the mixture and stir to combine.
4. Spread the mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crispy.
6. While the treats are baking, prepare the marshmallows. In a small saucepan, heat the marshmallows over low heat, stirring occasionally, until they are melted and smooth.
7. Once the treats are done baking, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. Add the marshmallows to the treats, stirring gently to combine.
9. Add the chopped peanuts to the mixture and stir to combine.
10. Spread the mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
11. Bake the treats in the preheated oven for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crispy and the marshmallows are melted and slightly puffed.
12. Remove the treats from the oven and let them cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Winner's Circle Treats!

6ee25d7bfc.gt:
Prepare bread pans,.
I just use Pam cooking spray.
In large mixing bowl: Beat eggs until frothy, add sugar, oil, molasses, vanilla, and zucchini, mix well.
Combine flour slowly, add soda,baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Also add nuts if desired.
Pour into bread pans, bake at 325F for 40 to 45 minutes or until you can stick a toothpick in and it comes out clean.
This recipe makes 3 large or 6 small bread pans.
This may vary.
6ee25d7bfc.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, brown sugar (or white sugar and brown sugar), and vanilla.
3. Add the chopped zucchini, corn oil, and molasses to the bowl. Mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and walnuts (if using).
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the raisins (if using).
7. Grease a loaf pan with cooking spray or butter, and pour the batter into it.
8. Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
9. Remove the loaf from the oven, and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

This recipe for zucchini bread made with brown sugar and molasses is a delicious and nutritious treat. The combination of zucchini, brown sugar, and molasses adds a unique flavor to the bread, while the inclusion of walnuts and raisins adds a touch of crunch and sweetness. The result is a moist and flavorful loaf that is perfect for breakfast or a snack.

78e1fe788f.gt:
Stir together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then stir-fry garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until almost cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Add half of romaine and stir-fry until it begins to wilt, then add remaining romaine and stir-fry until just wilted and shrimp are just cooked through, about 1 minute.
Stir sauce, then add to stir-fry and simmer, stirring, 2 minutes.
78e1fe788f.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a small saucepan, combine the reduced-sodium chicken broth, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens. Remove from heat and set aside.

2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and ginger, and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

3. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they turn pink and are cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes.

4. Add the romaine hearts to the skillet and cook until they are wilted, about 2 to 3 minutes.

5. Pour the sauce over the shrimp and romaine, and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the sauce has thickened.

6. Serve the shrimp and romaine stir-fry over a bed of white rice. Enjoy your delicious meal!

[/INST]

1832d9054d.gt:
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, toast the barley in 1 tablespoon olive oil for 2 minutes until it is fragrant and nutty.
Add the chicken stock, bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook 45 minutes or until most of the liquid is absorbed.
In a large cast iron (or other oven safe) skillet over medium heat, saute the onion and corn kernels in the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil until onions are slightly softened.
Season with salt and pepper.
Shove the onion and corn to the side of the pan, and add the chorizo into the pan.
Cook the chorizo, breaking it apart as it cooks.
When it is almost browned and cooked through, mix it with the corn and onions then shove the entire mixture to the side.
Create as much open surface on the base of the skillet as possible.
Add the kale, pressing down and turning over until it is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper, then mix it in with the chorizo, corn and onion.
Remove from heat.
Preheat your broiler to high.
Add the cream and 1 cup of cheese into the corn mixture.
Add the cooked barley and mix well.
Spread the entire mixture into an even layer, and top with the panko and remaining cheese.
Place skillet 6 inches under the broiler for 3 minutes until the top is melted and brown.
1832d9054d.pred:
To recreate the Corn, Chorizo & Kale Barley Bake, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the pearl barley, chicken stock, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 25-30 minutes, or until the barley is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
4. While the barley is cooking, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet or baking dish over medium heat. Add the sweet corn kernels, ground chorizo, and cook until the chorizo is browned and the corn is tender.
5. Add the torn kale pieces to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook until the kale is wilted and slightly tender.
6. In a small bowl, mix the heavy cream, shredded cheddar jack cheese, and panko bread crumbs. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Pour the cream mixture over the corn, chorizo, and kale mixture in the skillet. Stir to combine.
8. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the dish is hot and bubbly.
9. Serve the Corn, Chorizo & Kale Barley Bake immediately. Enjoy!

36b3caf34c.gt:
Preheat the oven to 325.
In a large enameled cast-iron casserole, heat the peanut oil.
Season the pork with salt and pepper.
Add the shanks to the casserole and cook over moderate heat, turning, until browned all over, about 20 minutes; transfer to a plate.
Add the onion to the casserole and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 4 minutes.
Stir in the water, miso, brown sugar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chiles and scallions.
Add the shanks and any juices and bring to a boil.
Cover and braise in the oven for 2 hours, until the pork is very tender.
Garnish with scallions and serve with rice.
36b3caf34c.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
2. Season the pork shanks with salt and pepper.
3. Add the pork shanks to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
4. Remove the pork shanks from the pot and set aside.
5. Add the onion to the pot and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
6. Add the water, miso, sugar, soy sauce, and ginger to the pot. Stir to combine.
7. Return the pork shanks to the pot, submerging them in the liquid.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 2 hours or until the pork shanks are tender.
9. Remove the pork shanks from the pot and set aside to cool slightly.
10. Strain the liquid through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean pot, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
11. Return the liquid to the pot and add the chiles. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
12. Remove the chiles from the sauce and discard them.
13. Return the pork shanks to the pot and cook for about 10 minutes or until heated through.
14. Serve the braised pork shank with miso sauce over cooked white rice.

[/INST]

This meal is a delicious and hearty dish that combines the rich flavors of the braised pork shank with the bold taste of the miso sauce. The dish is not only satisfying but also visually appealing, with the contrasting colors of the pork and the sauce. Enjoy your meal!

94d70d2bcc.gt:
Wash, dry, and cut broccolini into thirds.
Heat oil over high in a wok or similar type pan.
Stir fry the stems first for about 3-4 minutes.
You may need to turn the heat down to medium high.
Add the top leaf portion, and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
Shut off heat and add oyster sauce, stirring to coat.
Serve.
94d70d2bcc.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:
1. Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the broccolini and cook for about 3-4 minutes, or until it's slightly tender but still crisp.
3. Pour the oyster sauce over the broccolini and stir to coat evenly.
4. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the broccolini is cooked through.
5. Serve the dish immediately, garnished with chopped green onions if desired.

This dish is a delicious and healthy option that combines the nutty flavor of the broccolini with the rich, savory taste of the oyster sauce. The combination of these ingredients creates a satisfying and flavorful meal that can be enjoyed by both vegetarians and meat-eaters alike.

13ce606661.gt:
May ajust these seasonings to your own taste !
Grind porkfat and mix with lean pork.
Combine well.
Combine all seasonings and mix with pork.
Mix in well with hands and make a small patty and fry until done, Taste your product and ajust seasonings if needed.
Shape into patties and freeze on cookie sheets until hard.
Store in freezer containers until needed.
I use a slider mold to make patties.
Cook time is time in freezer.
13ce606661.pred:
To cook the Real Down Home Pork Sausage, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground lean pork, pork fat, salt, white pepper, sage, thyme, cloves, garlic, and msg. Mix well.
3. Add the cayenne pepper, if using, and mix again.
4. Shape the mixture into small sausages, about 3 inches long.
5. Place the sausages on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the sausages in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they reach an internal temperature of 160°F (70°C).
7. Remove the sausages from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into bite-sized pieces.

Enjoy your delicious Real Down Home Pork Sausage!

a040895990.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Mix together all ingredients except olive oil and garlic.
Place olive oil in the bottom of a casserole dish or square glass baking dish.
Rub the dish with one bulb of chopped garlic and leave the garlic in the dish.
Pour mixture into baking dish and bake for 30-40 minutes at 325 degrees.
a040895990.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the beaten egg, milk, and cooked rice.
3. Add the chopped onion, parsley, and minced garlic to the bowl.
4. Stir in the grated parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Drizzle the olive oil over the top of the mixture.
7. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the rice is cooked through.
8. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

ea87319f86.gt:
Roast the eggplant directly over a gas flame, turning occasionally, until charred all over and soft, about 12 minutes.
Transfer to a colander and let cool slightly, then peel and let cool completely.
Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, cook the garlic in the oil over moderate heat until sizzling, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and whisk in the vinegar, honey, rosemary, oregano and minced parsley.
Season the vinaigrette generously with salt and pepper.
Heat a large cast-iron skillet.
In batches if necessary, add the piquillos to the skillet in an even layer.
Cook over high heat, turning once, until lightly charred on both sides, about 2 minutes total.
Add the piquillos to the warm vinaigrette and let cool completely.
In a food processor, combine the eggplant with both cheeses and puree until smooth.
Scrape into a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Spread the whipped eggplant on toasts and, using a slotted spoon, spoon some of the marinated piquillos on top.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with anchovies.
ea87319f86.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Cut the eggplant into 1/2-inch (1.27 cm) thick rounds.
3. In a large bowl, mix the garlic, olive oil, red wine vinegar, honey, rosemary, oregano, parsley, salt, and pepper.
4. Add the eggplant rounds to the bowl and toss to coat evenly.
5. Spread the marinated eggplant on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and slightly caramelized.
6. While the eggplant is cooking, prepare the piquillo peppers.
7. In a small bowl, mix the goat cheese, cream cheese, minced rosemary, minced oregano, and minced parsley.
8. Once the eggplant is cooked, let it cool slightly.
9. Place the cooked eggplant on a serving platter.
10. Spread the goat cheese and cream cheese mixture on top of the eggplant.
11. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious-looking dish of Marinated Piquillo Pepper and Whipped Eggplant Toasts!

57e41370a3.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, nutmeg, and salt in one bowl.
In another bow, beat egg yolks slightly.
Beat in milk, bananas, and oil.
Add egg mixture to flour mixture all at once.
Stir just till combined but still slightly lumpy.
In small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold beaten egg whites into flour mixture, leaving a few puffs of egg white.
Do not overmix!
Pour batter onto pre-heated, lightly greased waffle maker.
Bake waffles according to manufacturer's directions.
Serve hot and fresh.
I topped mine with butter and syrup, and they were delicious!
57e41370a3.pred:
1. Preheat your waffle iron by placing it on medium heat for a few minutes.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks, milk, mashed banana, and cooking oil.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
5. Fold in the egg whites and nutmeg.
6. Pour the batter onto the preheated waffle iron, using a ladle or a spoon. Cook the waffles according to your waffle iron's instructions.
7. Once the waffles are cooked, remove them from the waffle iron and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious banana-wheat waffles!

86b69c2d99.gt:
Combine the vinegar, horseradish cream, and measured salt and pepper in a medium, nonreactive bowl and whisk until thoroughly mixed.
Whisking constantly, slowly pour the oil in a thin stream down the side of the bowl.
Whisk until completely incorporated.
Taste and adjust the seasoning as desired.
86b69c2d99.pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the champagne vinegar, horseradish cream, kosher salt, and pepper. Set aside.
2. In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, and red onion. Whisk to combine.
3. Slowly pour the whisked ingredients from the small bowl into the large bowl, whisking constantly to ensure a smooth consistency.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the creamy horseradish vinaigrette over a salad, as a dip for vegetables, or as a sauce for grilled meats or fish.

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

522f19c745.gt:
Place flat bread or shell on 14 inch pizza pan (or lightly grease a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Unroll the pizza dough onto the greased pan, using your hands to press the dough into a 14x 9 inch rectangle, build up the edges slightly.
Bake pizza dough in a 425F oven for 5 minutes.
remove from oven).
In a mixing bowl combine chicken and barbecue sauce, toss to coat.
Spread chicken mixture evenly over pizza crust.
Sprinkle with cheese and chopped spinach.
Bake in a 425F oven for 10 minutes or until crust edge is lightly browned.
Cut flat bread or bread shell into wedges (or cut rectangular pizza into squares.
522f19c745.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded cooked chicken, barbecue sauce, and 1 cup of shredded monterey jack cheese.
3. Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the focaccia bread or pizza dough.
4. Add the remaining 1 cup of shredded monterey jack cheese on top of the chicken mixture.
5. Add the chopped fresh spinach on top of the cheese.
6. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your homemade barbecued chicken pizza!

8c32c6a022.gt:
Make the dough.
Put all the dough ingredients except for the olive oil into a plastic bag, and knead it well to make the dough.
When the dough comes together, add the olive oil and keep kneading (10 minutes).
Leave it to rise in the bag (30 minutes).
When the dough has risen, press it down lightly to deflate.
Place it on a kitchen parchment paper lined oven tray and leave to rest for 10 minutes.
Cut up the toppings for the pizza crust.
Slice the sausages diagonally.
Slice the onion and cherry tomatoes.
Defrost the seafood mix.
Put olive oil on your hands, and spread the dough out to cover the oven tray.
Preheat the oven to 300C (or 250C if your oven doesn't get that hot).
Spread the dough with pizza sauce, and cover evenly with toppings of your choice.
Add the pizza cheese to finish.
Bake at 300C for 13 minutes.
Top with something like fresh basil leaves and cut into 8 portions.
It's very hot so be careful.
I tried varying the toppings by section.
You won't get bored with the toppings this way, and looks like fun too.
8c32c6a022.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake flour, bread flour, sugar, yeast, salt, and lukewarm water. Mix until a smooth dough forms.
2. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
3. Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
4. Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F).
5. Punch down the dough and roll it out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
6. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges for the crust.
7. Add the sausages, onion, mixed frozen seafood, cherry tomatoes, and mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce.
8. Fold the dough over the toppings, creating a half-moon shape.
9. Place the pizza on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving to your guests.

[/INST]

ac2ebd1a37.gt:
Preheat oven to 450F.
Prebake fresh pizza crust, if using, for 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove from oven, and set aside to cool slightly.
Brush oil on crust.
Top crust with sauce and artichokes.
Sprinkle with soy mozzarella, goat cheese and sun-dried tomatoes.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove from oven, and serve.
ac2ebd1a37.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. Prepare the pizza crust by rolling it out on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
3. Spread a thin layer of olive oil over the crust, leaving a small border around the edges.
4. Spread a generous amount of pizza sauce over the crust, leaving a small border around the edges as well.
5. Add the chopped baby artichokes or artichoke hearts, shredded soy, and mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce.
6. Drizzle the goat cheese over the cheese, and top with the sun-dried tomatoes.
7. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the pizza from the oven, let it cool for a few minutes, and then slice it into wedges.

Enjoy your delicious sun-dried tomato, goat cheese, and artichoke pizza!

03321392c1.gt:
Spread cut sides of roll with dressing and mustard.
Fill with remaining ingredients.

95fc2c99a6.gt:
Combine dry ingredients in large bowl.
Whisk remaining ingredients together; stir into dry mixture just until moistened.
Pour batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto a hot nonstick griddle coated with nonstick cooking spray.
Turn when bubbles form on top of pancakes; cook until second side is golden brown.
95fc2c99a6.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together buckwheat flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, low-fat buttermilk, and melted butter.
3. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
4. Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
5. Pour a small amount of batter onto the skillet or griddle, spreading it evenly to create a thin pancake.
